description:
You go for the authentic food, and you keep coming back for the friendly vibes.  

The mango salsa is like none other in Northern California! The guacamole is fresh and flavorful. 

Thank you Juve & taqueria los Mayas crew for bringing bomb food to the Richmond!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Friendly staff, delicious tacos, fast service, tvs for sports and news....Taco Tuesday's 2 for $6.75. The carne asada was tasty, camarones juicy. Awesome taco spot in inner Richmond! 

Can't wait to come back.
author: Dessa R.

description:
I ordered the Super Burrito and it was really filling! It was decently priced (~$11.75) and was ready quickly. The ingredients matched really well with one another, and was portioned out well. There was a good balance between the carne asada + beans, rice, etc. Also, I liked that the tortilla wasn't too doughy. 

On the side, they had a lot of sauces you could choose from (I liked the Habanero one because it was spicy). You could also grab some cilantro and onion to put in your burrito or chips. The only thing I'd change is having salsa at the bar as well. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here. It's at a convenient location and I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Aileen J.

description:
Recently opened this year and I can say I love this place! I had the panuchos and every bite has so many different flavors and very colorful as well. I can taste how fresh each item was made.

The staff is friendly and give you their personal favorite which is helpful when you're new to a restaurant. I came in and one of the staff was so kind to give our party a complimentary panucho so we could try an extra flavor of meat. Thank you!! 

But the reason why I give it a 5 star is for their churro! Hands down BEST CHURROS EVER. I've been in search for a bomb churro and this is the place. Trust me, get the churros.
author: Yenni H.

description:
I went to Taqueria Los Mayas on Cinco de Mayo for dinner.  I had never been there but heard it was very good through a mutual friend who works in the food industry.  

It was about 7PM on Cinco de Mayo Saturday, and Taqueria Los Mayas was (surprisingly) not busy.  Maybe everyone was eating out in the Mission rather than in Inner Richmond.   I walked straight to the counter to order dinner.  The menu is Mexican and Yucatan cuisine so I did not recognize many of the dishes.  The cashier (and I think owner?) noticed I hesitated at the counter.  He asked if I had ever been here, to which I replied no.  He gave me a hard copy of the menu then walked away before I could ask for his recommendation.  

I decided to order al pastor panuchos (Yucatan tacos) and a plantain burrito.  Delicious!  The menus has a mix of both recognizable and unfamiliar dishes.  I had never had panuchos or a burrito with plantains and loved every bite of both dishes!  

There are some quirks with service and operations but I would definitely come back for the food.

PROS: 
- Salsa and chips bar was on point (the green salsa is super spicy even for someone who loves spice!)
- Tasty food

CONS: 
- No alcohol
- Sticky tables (gross) so I had to wipe them down myself
- Not the most helpful staff but thankfully we picked out dishes that were satisfying
- There was empty water jug and no glasses in sight by the bar for self-service.  Staff replenished the water jug and provided glasses (only to me but did not take the time to get more glasses for other customers who may want water) eventually after multiple requests.
author: Cimma S.

description:
My friend living in Japan basically wanted non-Asian based cuisines while visiting me in San Francisco.  She's from LA, so I know I had to impress her with a good Mexican spot. So I took her here.

She ordered the tamales, and I got the plantain burrito.  We both ordered an horchata.  She loved it!  Prices are standard, but she did get a pretty decent portion.  Her order had 2 tamales, rice, and beans.  She only could eat half.  My burrito was also quite large.  I only could eat a third.

Now, one of my favorite dishes is plantains with black beans and crema.  To find it in burrito form is a dream come true! Both savory and sweet, all the flavors come together harmoniously rolled up in a tortilla.

It made a very good breakfast the next morning.

The restaurant is small, and you pick up your meal at the counter.  Your order also comes with 1 basket of chips, and there's different salsas available.

The first time I came here, I had a panucho with one of their chicken moles.  It was that dish that prompted me to come back here again.  I definitely want to try more of the dishes available on their menu.
author: Vira P.

description:
One of my favorite mexican places and I love how it's super good but not all the way in the mission since that's out of the way for me.
A little bit pricey, but the food just taste so good is makes it totally worth it. Free chips and a sauce bar so that really helps to fill you up! My favorite are the tostadas with shrimp soooo goooooodddddd!!!
Plus service is super friendly so that's a plus!!
author: Linda N.

description:
Los Mayas is located in a busy section of Clement street. 

Quickly scooted in here and ordered a Cochinita Pibil Taco which is a favorite meat of mine and not served at all taquerias. 

What came out fairly quickly was a delicious taco. 

Cochinita Pibil- Pulled pork braised in citrus and achiote 

Tortilla , meat and toppings were are very savory.

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Garaje
9 Taqueria Vallarta
10 Little Taqueria
11 La Taqueria
12 Taqueria Castillo
13 El Farolito
14 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
15 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
16 Panuchos
17 Taqueria Gudalajara
18 La Palma Mexicatessen
19 El Tonayense
20 Tropisueno
21 La Espiga de Oro
22 Papito Hayes
23 Tacos San Buena
24 Los Compadres Taco Truck
25 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
26 El Taco Loco
27 Gordo Taqueria
28 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.

2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description: Bumping up to 4 stars because their flavors are spot on.
author: Erica M.

description:
Ate here for late lunch/early dinner on a Saturday. Not very busy and nice ambiance inside.

No greeting from an unfriendly staff and one girl was eating chips behind the counter.

Ordering was fast and easy but my tacos came out greasy and cold. Despite all the rave reviews about the salsa, they were all bland except the spicy green salsa and the mango salsa.

Pastor was overcooked and fatty. Props for thick tortillas (but too bad they became soggy from the greasy conchinita pork).

Maybe some other menu items are better, but they managed to goof up tacos.
author: Krystal I.

description:
3.5 STARS

The roommate and I were shopping nearby. When looking for lunch spots, we decided to check out Taqueria Los Mayas. We arrived before the lunch rush on Monday, December 11th around 12:15pm. We placed our order for takeout.

Tacos de la Abuelita: pickled red onions, cabbage, salsa, cilantro ($3.75 each)
*Al Pastor: Mexico City-style barbecued pork
*Pollo Con Mole Poblano: a fusion of pueblan and yucatecan moles combining sweet habanero with a dozen spices
*Bisteca a la Mexicana: steak marinated in orange and lime juices, cilantro, onion, salt and pepper

I'm a taco girl, so I got the three tacos listed above. I love a nice smokey flavor in my meat, but most of these were more stewed, so a little mushy. Even the al pastor which was kind of weird. It did have a nice chew though. The taco tortillas were different. Not corn or flour, but more like masa. I didn't really eat the tortillas so I can't advise on the difference, but it did get soggy in transit and wouldn't stay together to eat as a taco.

*Breakfast Burrito: eggs, beans, rice, potato ($8), add Al Pastor (+$2.50)
*Elote Loco: street corn with mayo, cheese, chile ($4)
*Churros ($4.50)
*Chips (1st order free with purchase, additional order $2 each)

The roomie got the burrito, I got the elote, and we shared the churros. I adored the elote. The corn was cooked nicely. The kernels were plump and juicy. The mayo, cheese, chile, and lime added a nice contrast in flavor though I wish the mixture was thicker so it would stick to the corn more. The churros were amazing. Fresh out of the fryer, so a nice crispy exterior. The whipped cream did dissipate in transit, so there really wasn't any when we got home.

Salsas
*Salsa de Mango: mango, pineapple, orange juice, garlic, chipotle, salt & pepper
*Salsa Verde: tomatillo, jalapeno, garlic, cilantro, salt & pepper
*Salsa Ranchera: tomato, tomatillo, garlic and olive oil
*Salsa Habanero: fiery smoked habanero, garlic, onion and touch of tomato

They have a great salsa bar of the variety listed above along with Pickled jalapenos and carrots, Cilantro, Onions, Limes, and Radishes. I love salsa, so I got a 2-3 containers of each. My favs were the ranchera and habanero. The habanero had a nice kick. For some reason, I adore mango habanero, so mixing the two salsas provided that spicy sweet kick that enjoyed with the free chips.

The tacos weren't really my thing. Maybe I'm more into traditional meats like carne asada, but I felt they were the weakest item. Rounding up to 4 stars due to the service. Everyone behind the counter really was sweet and accommodating.
author: Elena N.

description:
Food took a while to arrive and we were starving when we got there. Plan to arrive earlier if you want to eat here.
I got the veggie sopas and my boyfriend, the chicken plantain burrito. Both were quite delicious - the sopas had a thicker corn base topped with veggies, avocado and some cheese and the plantain in the burrito added a really nice sweet twist to the standard burrito. They have a separate salsa bar but I didn't quite like the sauces they had in it. Our order came with a side of tortilla chips which were alright. The cashier was kind enough to go over the details of what a panucho and sopa was.
author: Preeti R.

description:
Deep down I'm a NIMBY about the Inner Richmond. I refuse to admit that this spot is not only needed but a great addition to the street.

Keep Hoods Yours and I hope it stays Chinese but sometimes I need a big old burrito! And if it takes Hipster Trash mentality to do it then so be it. I'm not always proud of the choices I make to keep my mental stability inline but I'm doing what I can to get by. Six to eight gut busters a week is a orthopedic level  so I need my distribution stations spread out simply for redundancy purposes. 

This isn't a great burrito but it's good. I order the Al Pastor. The meat is tender and just right but personally just a little too sweet for my taste. 

The things I despise are that it's super clean and bright with the entire, "Reclaimed Hipster Wood" and a TV the size of my apartment that did not have soccer or Telenovela.

But it's good. I hope they stick around. 

Make it a super!
author: Justin S.

description: This is in my top 2 Mexican restaurants in the city!  The food is fresh and on the lighter side which I appreciate.  My go to lunches are shrimp tacos or the salad.  The only thing missing for me are the cervezas!
author: Kendra M.

description:
Panuchos? I never knew one thing could change your life completely in a matter of seconds. Panuchos are like tacos but have a crunchy deep fried outer shell. It holds up a lot better than soft tacos. 

It's rare to find a place that serves tender succulent pastor, but I think I finally found a place that is on par to my standards. The pastor has pineapple that compliments the juiciness of the meat. 

The chicken mole here sadly was subpar. The sauce they drench it in doesn't mix well with the chicken. 

All orders come with tortilla chips which you can pair with one of their many sauces. Their sauce bar has this tangy mango sauce which has a great tropical flavor. You can also get pickled jalapeños and onions to put on your tacos.
author: Ada H.

description:
One of best tacos I've tried!!!
Tacos, all kinds of flavors. Horchata bomb! 
Place looks classy. Ingredients all fresh, unique house made ingredients, great attention to detail.
author: Eziz T.

description: For the churros alone, I'd give this place a solid five stars. The outer layer is perfectly thick and crispy with a generous coat of sugar and cinnamon to ensure that when you pick it up, any sugar and cinnamon that falls off would not affect the final taste. Inside, there is a very light brown colored filling which I can't quite put my finger on... It also comes with a side of whipped cream to dip your churro in. All in all, I came out a happy customer and would love to be back to try their main selections.
author: Lillian T.

description: Not an authentic mayan/yucatec food at all. Not even close to the real thing. I tried the panuchos.they were too greasy!
author: Johan P.

description: Yawn.  Meat tasted odd and had a crunch to it like the wrapping paper. Chips were bland. Would not return.
author: Jonathan A.

description: Freshly made guacamole and sauces. Rare found in SF Yucatán cooking. Fresh juice and vegetable.
author: lina w.

description:
Good tacos, and I like how they have lengua  as an option. The sauce bar was okay for what it's worth. Place is convenient for SFSU students and food is pretty authentic. 

Quick place to grab some tacos, burritos or rice and beans plate if you're craving Mexican food without going to the Mission.
author: Jamila W.

description:
My body have consumed over 2,500 unhealthy but satisfying burritos in my lifetime. I have never had a plantain in a burrito. But the newest taqueria in the inner-Richmond district offered the Plantain Burrito. The offering may be the first in the Bay area, though I am not so certain on that. When I heard this place offer that and without any hesitation, I was on it. 

For $11.00, I get plantain strips, which is grilled to sweetness, along with pico de gallo, sour cream, avocado, cheese, rice and beans in a grilled flour tortilla. You get the sweetness from the plantain combine with the savory ingredients. This is one of the most unique burritos I have ever eaten. I also get chips and salsa with my meal. The chips are made fresh in-house. 

The taqueria also offer meats cooked in various ways and can be served on burritos, tacos or any dinner plates. 

Latin-cuisines does lag along Asian-friendly Clement Street. But the new taqueria is indeed a welcoming addition to the corridor.
author: Matt G.

description:
Tasty Mexican food with beautiful mural, nice chill vibe, and super friendly staff is pretty hard to find in my hood! I was very excited to finally check out Taqueria Los Mayas tonight, and was pleasantly surprised by how extensive the menu is!

Free chips and salsa! The salsas were excellent! The spicy one we tried was not that spicy so don't be deterred.

Boyfriend got the Carne Asada Plato and I got two Al Pastor Panuchos. Loved the presentation! I had a bite of the carne asada and thought it was yummy. But boyfriend said meh and that he likes Papalote better. Although I feel like they kind of have different styles.

My panuchos were delicious overall, but it was a bit too greasy. I understand it was deep fried, but my hands were almost covered in oil. The al pastor tasted a little different too, perhaps because it's not a specialty from the Yucatán? Not the best I've had but not bad either. The pickled onions on my panuchos were awesome! I'd usually get 3 tacos but the 2 panuchos were more than enough to fill my food baby.

Definitely recommend if you are in the area and craving Mexican. But maybe not trek-across-town-for-it worthy.
author: Nana L.

description:
I had high hopes for a Mayan style taqueria but this place is just a hipster spin on regular taqueria. ( go to 24th and Alabama for taqueria stuff) Nothing stood out so we went with familiar things.
 Food was expensive for only 2 people. One burrito  and one quesadilla + soda for over $30. Was not made well. Chicken was in a pablano mole but was so bland and over cooked. Quesadilla was sloppily prepared and nothing special. 
Wont be back.
author: J. G.

description:
The salsa ranchera is excellent here (light orange) at the salsa bar. It is almost as good as the salsa at Papalote. The habanero salsa is truly spicy. Chips are included with entree, otherwise $2.

Tip for improvement: please instruct staff to include utensils and napkins with a takeout order, especially if it is not a simple burrito.

Consider changing the salsa cups to something larger. The ones provided are comically small and due to small size, much torque is required to open them resulting in splatter when filled.
author: Michael J.

description:
I have a bicycling buddy who finishes most of his rides with a "#tfl" on Strava, as in "tacos for lunch". Some of his lunch photos bring to mind surgical excisions. So, as you might suspect, tacos are not a go-to dish for me.

But this restaurant is inviting, and it has other dishes on the menu. My dining buddies have adopted it as one of the customary stops on our weekly restaurant rotation (they are creatures of habit). We always meet around 5:15 pm during the week, and the place is usually not busy at that time.

Since this gringo is not able to explain the dishes very well, you might look at the Los Mayas web site to get an idea of the offerings. Some dishes arrive in crisp tortilla shells. The salads I have had there include a nice variety of veggies tossed together with flavorful dressings. The pulled-pork quesadillas have an inviting, savory aroma. You might have to wait for the soup, however, and it might not be worth the wait.

The restaurant seems to cater to the local neighborhood. A place you go when you get home from work and the fridge is empty. You can sit by yourself on a stool with your burrito, and watch TV on the wall-mounted screens. You probably won't feel lonely or out of place.

You order what you want from a wall-mounted menu behind the cash register. They give you one of those flashing red, buzzing things, but sometimes they deliver the dishes to your table anyway. You can see the food being prepared in a kitchen behind the register.

The decor is airy, with big picture windows, high ceilings, and modern-plain style tables and countertops. Having both background music and no sound-absorbing materials to speak of, the place isn't exactly quiet. Table conversation takes a bit of effort. Recently families have discovered the place, and there has been the din of screaming children.

You're probably too young to remember the TV series "Get Smart", but if you do remember, think of the plexiglass "cone of silence" that Max's boss employed unsuccessfully for confidential conversations. Volume notwithstanding, the music has been pretty good at times, and once I broke into a brief salsa as we were leaving.

And speaking of breaking...

Those of us who, like myself, suffer from klutziness should take note of the concrete flooring. The Mexican Coke bottles shatter in dramatic fashion when they tumble off the table, leaving little doubt among your neighbors as to who has transgressed. The metal chairs don't slide very well, and tipping one of those can also be embarrassing.

Once when I was leaning over the counter to inquire about a menu item, my jacket caught a thick glass vase that they used as the tip jar (with emphasis here on the past tense). The thing exploded, scattering dollar bills, quarters, and pointy glass shards over some distance. I got on my knees to collect the money, which may have looked even worse--like a piñata party gone mad. 

Now there's another fragile-looking tip container there, so be forewarned about leaning over the counter.

Even as a non-aficionado of the cuisine, I can still find something I can eat for around $10-$12. I can tell them not to make it too spicy or use raw onions (my bugaboos).

Go ahead and try the place. But klutzy types beware!
author: Donald J L.

description:
Probably the best churro I've ever had. Cochinita pibil burrito was amazing. But the chicken burrito was dry/overcooked. I liked the salsa bar.

Just wish they served beer and more salsa options.
author: Kelly A.

description:
Would rate my burrito 2 stars, but the looks of other dishes looked better so may be back to try something else.

Regular burrito w/ 'child verde chicken'
Lack of flavor 
Small portion
CouldBEARLY If not at all taste the chill verde flavor. 
Just tasted like shredded chicken to me....
Some rice pieces were hard
Just overall pretty bland, and for the price $9!! meh...

The overall restaurant itself looks nice, offers plenty of seating and decently fast service, but burrito game is not on point there, try something else! 

They have empanadas, the soup looked good, might try if I'm in the area but as a last resort to other places.
author: Janessa H.

description:
So after having a bad experience @ panchos salsa grill on Geary, I decided to check out this place.

Ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito only.
As one of the workers brought my burrito & chips he asked if I had ordered a drink, I said no. He asked if I wanted to order one and I said no again. (On a diet)

But then....he offered me a drink on the house between pineapple and watermelon juice.....and damn I love pineapple juice. So I caved in. He gave me a nice tall glass of it and man it was gooood 

Burrito was also pretty solid, not horrible but not thee greatest burrito ever. SOLID.

RATINGS

burrito 7/10
Pineapple juice 10/10
Customer service 10/10

Will def. Come back if I can find parking in the area
author: Jose R.

description:
$16.28 for a plate of tofu, black beans, a side of guac and salsa, with no rice or tortillas (unfortunately I am allergic to rice and corn) is INSANE. When ordering, I had asked the lady at the counter if veggies could be included and she said yes, but then there were no veggies to be found on the plate, except the guac and salsa. 

I usually give restaurants a lot of credit and slack, but I'm just disturbed by the cost and why we even consider it acceptable to get charged prices like these. That's at least a $10 profit on a plate.  

I highly suggest that management take note of how other restaurants handle allergies and substitutes.
author: Chloé E.

description:
Finally stopped by after hearing rave reviews from a friend and am glad I did!  You can feel the love and heart that goes into the food!

I ordered a super burrito with cochinita pork - it was very flavorful and best of all, not a salt bomb. It also came with perfectly salted tortilla chips.   The salsa bar offers 5 different types of salsa - all fresh and delicious, ranging from non-spicy to habanero. 

This restaurant is a nice addition to the Clement dining scene. There are also vegetarian options - tofu con achiote and vegetables only (zucchini, bell pepper, onion, market veggies).  Can't wait to work my way down the menu!  Note that this is not your traditional Mexican taqueria - Yucatan dishes are the focus.  

Service was friendly and helpful. The owner (?) suggested the cochinita (pork) or bisteca (beef) since I couldn't decide on a filling - those seem to be their signature dishes.  Will definitely be back!
author: M G.

description:
Love this place! Super clean taqueria with fresh and quality ingredients. Never thought I'd really like any other taqueria other than La Taqueria in the Mission because I'm so picky but this has become close to my favorite! 

I ordered the platanos maduros (plaintains) and pork quesadilla to share and it was the perfect portion. Chips are also on the house with a good salsa spread to choose from. 

Food was absolutely 5 stars. -1 star because we waited a good 20 minutes for a food when there was no line. I will definitely be back.
author: Claudia C.

description:
We were driving along trying to find something to eat when I found Taqueria Los Maya's on Yelp. It was delish!  We are visiting from Texas, and Texans love their TexMex!  I got the quesadilla with Al Pastor and it was very good.  The tortilla was thin, and toasted perfectly for me!  The hubs got his California burrito finally!  He also got it with the Al Pastor and eat every bit!!  He even helped me with the HUGE quesadilla I got...and that burrito was huge too!
Almost forgot to add that it had the cleanest bathroom I've been in today!
author: Lisa S.

description: Taqueria Los mayas is my go to spot for panuchos and empanadas in the city, they run daily specials that vary so definitely check the sigh outside on the sidewalk! This taqueria definitely has a different spin on things especially when you order items most of the meats they use are very saucy and tender which can range from beef,pork, or chicken. This is the type of taqueria you definitely have to visit more then once to explore the whole menu! I'm glad they open up this establishment right in my backyard of the Richmond District!
author: Timothy C.

description:
My bf and I discovered this taco place on a walk nearby our house. We were hungry, saw this well lit Mexican restaurant, with a sign outside saying "Taco tuesday." Looked up the reviews on yelp - solid 4 stars. Dined by impulse and hunger.

I got the 2 tacos for $5 that Tuesday. Otherwise they're priced at 3.75 each. They were on the smaller side though, so I would recommend getting 3. I got the Cochinita Pibil (pork marinated in fresh citrus juice, annatto and achiote, roasted in banana leaves for 6 hours), and the Bisteca a la Mexicana (steak marinated in orange and lime juices, cilantro, onion, salt and pepper). I just didn't like my tacos because both were so WET. SO soggy. Just kind of ruined both tacos, especially the soft shell. We also got guacamole to share (chips are on the house btw), but the chips were just room temperature, not hot. Also I prefer chunkier guac, and theirs was on the thin, pureed side. My bf got a burrito, and HE even said his burrito was soggy! It was kind of a bummer. I don't know where they got their 4 stars from. I wish we had the 4 star experience too!

Restaurant is super clean though, a rarity for Mexican restaurants in SF. I think it was recently remodeled or something. Bathroom is clean too! Service was decent too. Just food was not my thing.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
A solid mexican food spot but not exceptional.  I ordered the carnitas burrito ($7.99), which was good but not great.  The restaurant is clean and the salsa bar is solid - be warned though, as the 'spicy' salsa is really really hot, which is something I appreciated.  If you live in the neighborhood, I'm sure this would be a solid, go-to spot but in a city where you can have food from your favorite restaurants delivered to you quickly and easily, I'd likely go elsewhere.

If you're in the neighborhood, definitely try this spot out since the restaurant is well run and the food is solid without being over spiced / flavored.
author: Tom G.

description: Wonderful neighborhood taqueria, serving fresh high quality foods with unmatched marinated meats. Must have!
author: Eduardo S.

description: Great Mexican food! Tortillas made fresh! Awesome selection of food. Everyone in our party greatly enjoyed their meal!
author: Ray L.

description: This was my first time coming here thanks to other yelp reviewers. I saw the pictures on here, and the food looked so beautiful and colorful. I decided to get the tacos de abuelita with al pastor. They give you so much meat that the tortilla almost broke off on me. Also, I love that they give chips with three types of salsas. Salsa Verde is my favorite salsa, and I basically ate it all with the chips. I can't wait to come back to try the other dishes.
author: Allyson L.

description: Bit expensive and fancy for my taste, but quality ingredients and service. And a very good selection of salsa.
author: Tony B.

description:
Wow, this place has very good food.  I want to come back again and again to try more items.  The only issue thus far is unrelated to the food.  They have had some issues with their cashier staff, but I know they are working on it.  

A breath of fresh air in the Richmond district.  So great to have an excellent Taqueria here!
author: S F.

description: Incredible, authentic Mexican. Open all day. Friendly staff.   The camarones taco was the best.
author: Danielle K.

description: Taqueria Los Mayas- what a great addition to the Inner Richmond! You can't go wrong eating a few tacos and the Super Quesadilla was delicious. The chips and different salsas are also a great compliment. My only complaint is that it takes a pretty long time for you to get your food- especially if there's a line.
author: Grace L.

description: Tacos were ok, dad really like his fish. Other dishes looked good. Front desk ladies were nice
author: J C.

description:
This place just went way up in my book. I always thought the food was decent. But HATED that we had to ask for salsa from the cashier. The scoops they provided were pitifully small, and I had to ask often since I'm a condiment junky.

But today I walk in and what do they have?! A salsa bar!!! Now I can serve myself as much salsa as I want.

I grew up in the Mission and know my taquerias. This place isn't bad. A little pricy, but besides Little Taqueria, it's some of the best you're going to get in the Richmond District in my opinion.
author: Yelper F.

description: Parking is ridiculously hard to find. The cashier seemed irritated that he had to take our order. Our drinks (3 medium sized horchatas) didn't come until 1/2 way through our meal and they were lukewarm with no ice. The food was AMAZING!!! I got the grilled shrimp burrito. The shrimp was cooked to perfection and everything tasted so good. My sister got the vegetarian burrito. This is seriously a vegans dream come true!! It comes with plantains , guacamole, beans, and salsa. It was better than my burrito. This place has the best tasting Mexican food I've ever had. Unfortunately, the service is terrible. The prices are a little steep but worth it. The only thing is I wouldn't get a drink there.  At $4 for a lukewarm drink is just not worth it. If you can see past their service, go on and enjoy some yummy food.
author: Helene D.

description:
Best Mexican restaurant in San Francisco.

Authentic Mexican Yucatan food, great atmosphere & fast service.

Try the panuchos & the mango salsa!!!
author: Niko P.

description:
For a quick lunch spot, this place is not a bad choice! It's got a really chill, laid back vibe, good music, and good, speedy service. I really can't complain too much.

Coming in at 1 PM on a Monday, there was a short line of like 4 people, but it didn't take very long for us to order. It looks like a lot of people order stuff to-go, so the restaurant wasn't packed on a weekday. 

I ordered the Pescado Del Dia burrito, which totaled up to be $10.75. The listed burrito price was $8.75 and I didn't see anything obvious saying that the fish option was going to cost more, but I didn't read the menu that thoroughly, so that might be on me. I did have to look at one part of the menu to see the burrito option, and another part of the menu to see the meat options, so I admit I did get confused. But to be honest, I kind of expected an upcharge for fish, so I wasn't super fazed by it. 

They give you one of those buzzer things for your order, so I grabbed some free ice water they had up front, and about 7 minutes later I picked up my order with some free chips and salsa. 

The chips were semi-warm and my burrito was piping hot, like it was fresh off the stove. The chips were pretty average, and the salsas were pretty good. There was an orange-colored salsa with black pepper-like specks in it that people who don't enjoy spicy food should probably avoid. It was like eating a mouthful of lava, but lava with pretty good flavor. The salsa verde was pretty standard.

I think my burrito was filled with Spanish rice, because the rice had a really deep but not overpowering tomato flavor, which really sets it apart from other places. The fish was really nice and flaky and had a good clean flavor. With the really flavorful rice, the nice big chunks of fish, and the burrito staying hot all the way through my meal, it was really a good experience! 

The size of the burrito was pretty solid. I wasn't hungry at the end of the meal, but it wasn't going to weigh me down either. For the price in the location it's in, it's not a terrible value, but it's not cheap either. 

Overall, it was a pretty solid experience! I'd definitely give it a try if you're in the area and craving Mexican, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Eric Y.

description:
MADRE DE DIOS!!!

This place is africkinmazing.  Great, great food! Taqueria staples in a perfect setting plus all of the insanely good bonus items like plantains and empanadas.  Be advised portions are generously sized and you may not be able to stop eating until the plate is clean.  The thing is I never leave this place feeling like I ate too much.  Always, leave with a feeling of I didn't eat enough!!! The food is that good.
author: Randy Q.

description:
I'm very frustrated with Taqueria Los Mayas and not sure if I'll try them again. First time I ordered the food was great! I got the sopes with grilled veggies and it was delish. Friend got a torta that he also enjoyed. Came with a large bag oh tortilla chips and we added a side of tasty pico. 

Next order seemed like it was from a different place! The food looked a mess as if thrown together quickly and the bag of chips was tiny and not even half full. Even worse, I ordered the plantain burrito and it had cheese. I rechecked the menu to see if I misread and it did not list cheese. I have a dairy allergy and would definitely ask for it to be left off had I the choice.

I really want those sopes again but idk if it's worth it to risk bad service or allergens in my food.
author: Barie W.

description: I don't have to travel to the Mission district anymore for awesome taqueria food ever again!  Delicious & huge empanadas & they serve my absolute fave...Platanos Maduros. So so happy to have found this awesome place right on Clement Street.  Please stay put & don't ever go away Taqueria Los Mayas!
author: Emy B.

description: They charged me $17 for a salad listed as $10. Then they refused to fix the overcharge. I will be taking this to my bank of course but I'm floored they would even consider treating customers this way.
author: Janis E.

description: Good food. Good location . Take it to go, go, go. Good. Bueno burritos, tacos are awright
author: Eileen G.

description: Delicious food and a very friendly staff. Los Maya's will become my go-to taqueria now that I've moved to the Inner Richmond.
author: Bob L.

description: I've only had the panuchos because I was a huge fan of Panucho's on Broadway before it closed. I heard the chef is now here. Really good, especially adding the various salsas from the salsa bar. Not quite as good as Panucho's (I think the food was more freshly made when you ordered vs. now maybe pre-made and warmed) but still really good. Only a Panucho's fan would know the difference. So glad this place opened.
author: Ruth C.

description:
Pros:
Food came out pretty fast, given it was lunch time on a weekday. The size of the burrito was decent for the price and it was great that they include chips and salsa, whether it was dine in or to-go! Also, the flavor of the sauces and salsa were amazing! One of the salsa they gave was sweet but had a good kick to it. The chicken I got was called pollo asado motuleno and the juice was delicious. 

Cons:
I asked if they could accommodate a burrito bowl rather than a burrito but they said they couldn't. Other than that, I would definitely try this place again!
author: Jessa May C.

description:
Taqueria Los Mayas has a menu i didn't understand. ordered the "catch of the day" (catfish) Ceviche. 

was asked if i  wanted a plate. bowl, salad, etc.,........so i said plate

eats: ordered Ceviche (15) actually got Pescado Del Dia(15.5) receipt says 
-catfish was fried for some reason, came with 4 warm corn tortillas, yummy chips, refried rice, salsa of tomato, lime, corn, avocado, mango, mole sauce(?) brown looking.
-3ish pieces of catfish just average, nothing outstanding.
-wrapped fish, rice, salaa in tortilla, just so so
-homemade chips best part of meal.
-would repeat if i understood menu. too many choices compacted into 2/3 columns.. not apparent to me.
-clearly told cashier i wanted ceviche, when she asked me about plate, seems she knows little of the menu also.

news on net: "British Intelligence warned Tony Blair of Manchester-like Terrorism is the West
Invaded Iraq".
*BlaIr concealed these warnings from the British People", claiming the invasion of Iraq would lower the risk of terrorism.
see "Clilcot Report" 7 year investigation (the intercept,5/23/17)
author: Victor G.

description: So yummy!! I tried their steak and pork burritos and loved them. Their menu has a wide variety of meats and sauces. They have special brunch options on Sundays too! The space is a little small, so during meal hours on weekends it can be tricky to find a spot, but other than that this place is great :)
author: Amanda F.

description:
OMG for take out for the first time. Food was SO fabulous...!
They got all our order perfect, even my wife's who has multiple allergies. 
Some of the BEST fish tacos I've had.....!
author: Leather M.

description:
Duuuuudes, ok, straight up...I'm Latino and I didn't have very high expectations for this place when I saw it was coming through. Figured it'd be a better than chipotle, but more expensive too, to capture the demographic out in SF. 

Anyway, the food is bomb. I love how most of the typical dishes are already set, you just pick your protein and your money! Best proteins (the only ones I've tried) were Conchita Pibil (pork) and Pollo Mole Poblano (chicken). Personally the chicken one is sooooo bomb, the poblano gives it a nice smoke and contrasts the sweet mole. Conchita Pibil is just a goddess of a tender pork, just try it.

Tortas (sandwiches) are decent size. I think it's called panuchos, which is just a black bean stuffed flat taco with your choice of protein and lettuce is bomb dot com too.

Agua frescas are expensive, so no for me. Yes this place caters to the new market, but they compensate for it with great service, awesome Latino music, and great food. Orale Taqueria Los Mayas, buena suerte y bienvenido al Richmond Distrito!
author: Aaron C.

description:
The wait for a good Mexican spot in the Richmond is finally over. I stopped in shortly after 11 and there was already a couple of people in there. The person behind the counter was friendly and helpful when I asked for some recommendations. 

I'd never had a panucho before, so I ordered three: cochinita pibil, poc chuc, and al pastor. All three were delicious - I could taste bold flavors on each one. The portion size was great. The protein was stacked onto the panucho and in addition the toppings like avocado and pickled red onion made them a little hard to close and eat (which is an awesome thing).

The only slight negative I had was regarding my elote. The flavors were great and the corn used was really, really fresh but I just wished there was more of the mayo, cheese, and chili on it. All three of those things were on top of the corn, but the side still in contact with the husk felt a little neglected.

All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch here. This will be my go to spot for Mexican food by a long shot in this area. I'll be sure to try the burritos and other menu items next.
author: Justin P.

description:
ever since game of thrizzones and 3rd season black mirror partially shaved head chicks are dope af. including the cashier* here when i showed up on TACO TUESDAY niñooo.

menu format is column a column b pick a shape for your food & pick a meat (or veggie f u) to go in it #twss. i got 4 panuchos aka tacos + a brek burrito por cena idgaf.

(^_^) Breakfast Burrito Cochinita Pibil $ ()
yes muhfuh

(^_^) Panuchos $4.25 ea + $3 seafood ()
al pastor troy, poc chuc, carne asada, camarones
didn't 100% know which was which but all good

funniest part was an actual mexican family (like not white ppl not asian foodies not hipster ig muhfuhs but irl no ingles familia) was there wonder wth they thought of the authenticity of the food.

-1 star bc employee wearing a detroit tigers shirt wtf this is GO GIANTS territory!!

*seemed shaven when i was close up then from afar looked not; w/e doesn't alter my opening statement bz.
author: Dan B.

description:
Delicious, fresh and good people! The owner used to be our favorite server at Bella Trattoria and has now opened his own venture. Customer service super on point and the food is amazing!

Try the panuchos, tostadas, and the pozole soup!!
author: Gina R.

description: FINALLY a great Mexican spot in the Richmond! We have been waiting for this for a long time. You no longer have to trek to the mission for a good burrito. Also get the Cochinita pubu (spelling?) it's an amazingly delicious pork and you can't beat the salsa bar here.
author: Lindsey E.

description: Delicious food and great staff.  Love their panuchos.  Wish they had a  place closer to home - would go their often!!
author: Shirley M.

description:
I had a chance to try this place today for the first time. It had just open 2 days ago. I have one word it... AMAZING.

The presentation, the service, the food, everything was just on point.

My top 3 choices. I suggest you try the chicken mole, al pastor and the cochinita pibil, delicious. Give the panachos a try, pretty good. It is good mix together with the tacos option.
author: Jorge G.

description: Wow! I'm so happy that there is a bomb ass Mexican restaurant in the Richmond, yay!  This place is soooooo good.  Everything is delicious! Tables inside and friendly staff.
author: Jenna C.

description:
The food lacked taste . Not enough spices.
The man taking my order was cold and unfriendly a bit bitchy .
The combo of those was a straight buzz kill . I recommend poncho villa on 16th st. Near Valencia in the mission if you want proper Mexican food .
author: E J.

description:
Amazing! I live couple of blocks away and I keep coming back for more... chicken tortilla soup, burritos, salads, excellent. Food is made to order!!!! Friendly staff.
Highly recommended.
author: Philippe R.

description: Yummmm :) My friends got the plantain burritos and empanadas. I got the regular burrito. They were hefty portions and tasty!
author: Mako U.

description: A pure diamond surrounded by all the Asian restaurants, bubble tea and dim sum places located in the Inner Richmond District between 4th and 5th on Clement Street. Chef Jose and his team are consistently kicking out some great freshly prepared ingredients from his roots in the Yucatan area of Mexico. Everything is prepared at the time of ordering hence there will be a slight wait but you will be truly rewarded once you take your first bite. The pork panuchos are my favorite as well as the super burrito which I also ordered with grilled chicken. While waiting definitely try the sample of various dipping sauces with the free chips that are provided.  In closing, a definite must if you are yearning for some quality Mexican food with attention to detail and food safety.
author: Richard H.

description:
Wow.
I got the plantain (not plain) burrito and it was many thick cuts of plantains browned in butter and stuffed in a tortilla along with sour cream, guacamole, beans, rice, salsa, and I got Pollo Asada as a filling. Pollo Asada was thick, flavorful cuts of what looked like chicken breast. This thing was huge. Maybe it's just been a while since I've had a burrito, but this thing is going to keep me dreaming about burritos for the foreseeable future.
author: Michael P.

description: We are so happy Clement Street finally got a decent Mexican joint. We think they have the best quesadillas in town. We usually get the chicken verde and one quesadilla is enough for two people. Their salsa bar is phenomenal and unique. Definitely a must try especially if you live in the neighborhood.
author: Rachel F.

description: This is one of my favorite burrito places.  Many different meats for burritos and all very tasty. Huge variety of delicious foods as well.  Give them a try.  It is a bit more expensive than Gordos but definitely worth the money. The only issue I have is that every so often the cash register woman isn't friendly to me.   But I'm there for the food, not the company.
author: Acura Nsx T.

description:
Got the cochinita panucho,pollo mole panucho, carne asada taco, and al pastor super burrito. 

Cochinita panucho: solid. 3.5/10. Good flavors. Nice crunch. Needs some salsa on it though. 

Pollo mole: 4/5. The mole was pretty flavorful. Chicken flavor didn't come through but as a package, it works 

Carne asada taco: 3.5/5. Nothing special. Definitely needs the lime. The tortilla broke through. Very juicy though and the meat had good flavor. 

Al pastor "super" burrito: 3/5. Definitely not enough guac and I'm not sure where the creme was. Overall, very carb heavy and not enough meat. The small amount of meat in the burrito was pretty flavorful but in my opinion, just a tad too much rice and the texture of the rice wasn't particularly good either. Almost brittle. 

Overall score: 3.5/5. But yelp doesn't allow scoring in 0.5 increments so I'll have to give it a 4. Overall, pretty flavorful dishes, though I'm not sure how authentic it is. And service was pretty fast. But poor layout with the cash register, dish drop off and bathroom on the far left and all the long tables and the customer line in the way. Hard for the wait staff and everyone else to get around and for people to stand in line without getting in people's way.
author: J P.

description:
I'm not really an authority on the authenticity of Latin cuisines, but Taqueria Los Mayas really exceeded all my expectations. Loved my horchata and my tacos. I ordered pescado, al pastor, and poc chuc as my meat bases. (My friends ordered sopes and a burrito and also enjoyed their meal!) 

The corn tortilla was so so good and really complemented the protein well. It does call for a messy meal with how juicy and wet everything is, but again it's so worth it! Def recommend the al pastor and poc chuc. (Fish taco was a little difficult to eat)
author: Brandon L.

description:
Yaaaaaayyyyyy, finally a solid Mexican spot in the neighborhood!

Yuca style Mexican with amazing dishes far beyond what is usually available at your go-to taqueria. Skip the burrito and try something new!
author: Reishi A.

description:
This taqueria receives just 2 stars from me tonight.  My first time to try it.   
A star for the taste of the food, it had a good flavor and taste to it.  
A star for the Manager who was helpful and courteous receiving my concern and complaint.  My concern was about the way the Taco Salad is prepared by one of the cooks who used his bare hands to handle ALL the raw food such as salad greens, tomato, cucumber, mango, etc...and then taking some of the food ingredients out of the Taco salad he started to put together because he made an error in making it, then putting that same food ingredient on the line counter alongside the dirty rags they used to wipe down the counter, then put it back into the NEW salad he made for me (per the Manager's and my request.
As I watched him do this, I should have videotaped him and reported his process to the Restaurant Licensing bureau, but i thought of videotaping after the fact.  I was shocked at how careless this cook was.    I hope the Manager and this cook review their ways of food prep before they make someone sick with careless food poisoning.  
He made my Taco Salad a total of 3 times.  The 3rd time because I spoke to the Manager about how he made the 2nd one.   Why did I even give it a second chance?  Good question!   
I mean well by writing this honest review.    Good tasting food is NO good if it's not handled clean and properly!   I suggest this restaurant start by getting some food handling utensils like salad tongs.   And develop some care in food prep.   Food is Sacred, it nourishes all the functions of our body, it and the customer should be treated with respect.   Otherwise, bad business.   
Also in the bag of chips we found a wire tie mixed in with the chips.   See photo.  
Thank you.  I wish this taqueria well to improve their food prep.   I hope the cook takes this review as food for thought how he can do his job in respect to whom he is preparing for.   There's already too much lack of care in this world.   Peace
author: Amor L.

description: Los Mayas will be the forever go to when I'm in the Richmond.  The pastor is legit.  It's hard to find decent mexican food in SF unless you're chomping down on burritos in the mission.  If you're wondering about the Toastadas....just know that its hard to eat unless you got a big mouth and if you got a big mouth you might not want to flaunt it around here.
author: Vince L.

description:
Got here at 1130. It was empty. We ordered 2 breakfast burritos. and waited. For 20 minutes. 

Finally our buzzer buzzed but when we hungrily bit into our burritos, we realized to our dismay that they had gotten our order wrong! Normally we would have ignored it and eaten it anyways but they were $14 burritos so we alerted the staff. 

They profusely apologized and about 15 minutes later, someone actually walked the burritos to our table. SO, so sweet. This quickly made up for the mistake until my boyfriend bit into his burrito to find that they once again had gotten it completely wrong. Mine was right and was fine, not great. 

Moral of the story: okay food, but go to the Mission for real Mexican!
author: Molly S.

description:
I wanted to add to my old review about ordering what kind of beans on your burritto- if you want refried beans, you have to specify "refried pinto beans" 

I honestly have never been to a restaurant where the default beans are not refried or whole pintos. So the 1st time I ordered, I didn't specify, and got black beans!

My fault for not specifying, so the next time I was sure to order refried beans. I got refried black beans!! Never in my life has that happened anywhere!

Next time, I specified refried pinto beans, and I ended up getting whole pintos! I wasn't sure at this point if they even had refried pinto?

4th time was the charm, I actually got the right beans. But 4 burritos for almost $10 a piece, and I decided I really don't like their food that much. I wish I liked it more. But it's just too plain for the very high price. My husband has gotten the tacos and they are minuscule! 

I also got the chipotle tofu 3 out of 4 times. The spicyness varied from medium to none. But it was moist, which is great. There should be some moisture inside the tofu.
author: Venus S.

description: Bombz!!! We were coming from LA and this place is on par with some of the best, like Guisados level. Get the plaintains, elote, and beans as sides, and the grilled fish and al pastor for tacos and/or tostadas, and you will be very happy. The al pastor taco was absolutely divine- juicy, perfectly grilled, and with ample pineapple. San Francisco needs more legit Mexican restaurants beyond the foot long burrito joints and this is it- handmade tortillas and salsas and a varied, authentic menu. And oh, the chicken mole is also worth getting in a taco. It's  impressive that they do grilled and stewed meats this well.
author: Spencer J.

description:
Relatively new Taqueria in Inner Richmond, this is probably one of my new favorite Taquerias. 
The atmosphere is relaxed, spacious, and very clean. Also a pretty cool mural on the wall behind the salsa bar -- which by the way is phenomenal.  I mix the mango and habanero salsa and I would say it's possibly the best I've had - be warned tho, it is very spicy and not for the faint-hearted. :) 

Added note: the ranchera and salsa verde are top notch as well. 

Anyway, for main course. MY girlfriend and I had the Pozole Verde which was super tasty. Full of bold unique flavors and spices. A very comforting stew to say the least and a large portion at that, so g/f and I shared.  Along with that we each had a yucatecan style taco basically, called a "panucho". Open faced, colorful pickled red onion, avocado, black beans, fresh masa house made crispy tortillas and super juicy, delicious pork. Probably the highlight, but it's hard to choose between that and the marinated steak burrito which was also incredible.  All of this accompanied by fast, awesome service I will definitely be stopping in more frequently to discover what all this spot has to offer. A well deserved 5 stars.
author: Stephen M.

description:
I do this knowing full well it may screw me from not having to wait in line.

So as some "old school" yelpers know I am a MASSIVE mission burrito hater.  Primarily for it's old dry meats and ridiculous protein to starch ratio.  And especially for all the undeserved hype from people who have either not been around or grew up on Taco bell.  SHAME ON YOU!!!

*deep breath*.....ok.... So this place has made me believe. 

All their land based proteins are freaking amazing...you know why?  Reason 1: Cause it's cooked fresh!  It hasn't been sitting in a stupid meat warming bin.  How do i know it's cooked fresh...well ONE the meat isn't a dry bland mess.  and TWO it takes 10-20 minutes for your order to come out....coincidentally as long as it cooks to cook up a Spanky sized order (order for 2 or 3 humans). Reason 2: the Chef is amazing!  Did this guy have some kind of amazing restaurant he left just to rough it in our hood?  For real i dig his mad attention to detail.  The presentation was a feast for the eyes and his food don't deliver lies be dropping pounds to them thighs!  

The other had the fish and that ish was good too!  So yea 5 effing stars for this place for putting all those hyped mission burrito taqueria's to SHAME.....SHAME!!!!!!

Cochinita Pibil?  Bomb!
Puc Choc?  DOT COM!

Chicken Asada Motuleno?  Make room!
Carne Asada?  why would you get carne asada at place with so many other unique options?? Its fine, but WHY?!?!

As the sign says...be patient good food takes time.

This place is in a class of it's own comparing it to other Oxacan places is not even fair. 

Welcome to the hood Taqueria Mayas happy to have you !
author: Spanky M.

description: Great addition to this neighborhood (which is famous for its amazing Asian/Asian-inspired food options) the service is great, the staff is friendly and courteous. And the food is even better, I have tried multiple items in the menu and I have LOVED them all. I inquired about a panucho once (didn't know what it was) and I was served one with my order as a courtesy!! My hubby now orders it every time. The tostadas are delicious and the taco salad bowl super yummy (and filling for a salad). This has become a regular for us, and would recommend it every time.
author: Fiorella L.

description: Great Taco Place, fod was great but the Salsas omg they are great reare to find a place with great taste, i enjoy a salsa verde with pork and was really good, husband had the cochinita pibil also great, even their chips where good one of my girls had chiken tacos and the tortillas are hand made, but this is a must place to stop and try
author: karla m.

description: This food is the best I have tasted in Clement Street. Definitely the best Mexican food. My daughter had visited with her Dad and insisted we go to try the beef cooked in beer. She loved her tacos with beef and I tried the fish. My son had a burrito. The flavors in the meat and fish, the sauces, vegetable toppings and guacamole were all outstanding. There was a quality to this food that we haven't had elsewhere in the City - well done Taqueria Los Mayas!  I hope you get a beer license soon so I wash my next meal down with a cold lager :)
author: Kate M.

description: Simply one of the best Mexican joints in town. The mole is deep and complex. Chips are fresh. The staff is pleasant and the vibe is convivial. This is a taste of Mexico City street food in the Richmond!
author: Baba D.

description: Friendly service + delicious, reasonably priced food = happy Sarah! I stopped by for dinner and ordered a breakfast burrito with conchinita pibil. The food was prepared relatively quickly, and both the cashier and person who handed me my order were pleasant. I noticed the bag was HEAVY, and when I peeked inside there were tortilla chips, which were a bonus because I hadn't been expecting them! When I got home, I realized the burrito was not only piping hot because it was made fresh to order, but it was also HUGE. You definitely get your money's worth here - I was able to make two meals out of my gigantic burrito. It was tasty and the pork was wonderfully seasoned and tender.
author: Sarah B.

description: Excellent food that tastes very fresh and not your normal boring flavors. Especially like the sopes but everything we've tried has been very good. No beer!  A little expensive but paying for quality and well prepared dishes.
author: Jay D.

description:
The Richmond needed this place and it delivers. The tamales are deliciously authentic, paired with a huge California-style salad. The burrito was juicy but manageable without a fork, and the tortillas were homemade, crunchy, salty and I wanted like 40 of them. 

Go here to support our new local business in the Richmond.
author: Sara H.

description: Stopped in for take-out. I ordered a tofu taco, shrimp taco, and elote. I was disappointed when I got home and there was no tofu taco in my bag. I wasn't charged for it, but it was what I was most excited to try. The person taking my order obviously didn't hear me order it. The music was really loud, I think it was because they were just opening for the day and still getting things set up. The shrimp taco was bland and didn't have much flavor. The elote lacked flavor as well. The corn wasn't sweet at all, which made the lime and mayo overpowering. I like that they make their own tortillas. I still would like to try the tofu taco and breakfast burrito. I'll give it a couple more try's and update my review.
author: Yvonne S.

description:
Yay, Mexican food in my neighborhood! 
In all honesty, when I first when here for a burrito I was underwhelmed. I have to say that I've been back twice for tacos and they are delicious. Just realized they do a Taco Tuesday deal 2 for $5 and I think I'll be here weekly :)
The tortillas are perfect and the meat and salsa were so flavorful. I got chicken verde, and my boyfriend got the mole'. Both yum!
The habanero salsa was hot without compromising on flavor, and they generously offered to refill our chips.
author: Chelsea V.

description: My girlfriend really likes a couple items at this place (esp. the plantain burrito with cochinita).  I like carne asada in general, but the two times I've gotten it here, it's been 80% gristle and tendon, hardly any beef.
author: David C.

description:
This is probably the best mexican food that "the Richmond" has to offer; with respects to Gordos.

The steak burrito was good, with juicy cuts of marinated steak. The steak taco was also really good, the torilla used on the taco tasted 'house made' and fresh. Chips took me to flavortown, but the spicy salsa was a bit too mild for my taste. And finally I ordered the churro which came filled with caramel, just what the diabetes specialist ordered; that was actually my favorite part since I have a major sweet tooth! I had also ordered a elote which wasn't thoroughly cooked but I was still able to lick the butter off.

One thing that did bother me was salsa trays, they were so small i had to go up for seconds. A full salsa bar would be nice.

I would have given this place a Solid 4 but because of their amazing service and kind demeanor they deserve the extra star! This will definitely be my go-to place whenever I'm in the Richmond.
author: Abraham A.

description:
Hidden gem in the Richmond District!! 

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. This place beats any Mexican restaurant in the Mission District. I'm from Mexico, and I must say that the flavor here is very authentic. If you haven't tried Yucatecan food (from Mayan region of Mexico), try the panuchos with cochinita pibil and with poc chuc.
author: Diego O.

description:
Uses frozen meats, which 99% of Yelp reviewers are too stupid and inexperienced to identify, having never worked in a kitchen or taken any culinary training.

Conchinta Pibil sauce has way too much salt.

Al Pastor sauce is respectable.

$4.50 for a horchata.

Go spend time in Playa del Carmen, Akumal, Tulum, and you'll try the real thing.

Rice is dry and salty.

Black beans not soaked long enough.

Guacamole a bit on the watery side, lacking lime and salt.

Had a lot better at no name restaurants in the Yucatán.
author: Edward S.

description:
lots of potential but missed the mark in a few regards.
pro: the tortillas are pretty amazing!  salsa were good.
con: the food was served lukewarm, was somewhat mild, and the beans were undercooked.  
I'll try it again in hopes for improvement, we need a great taqueria on this side of town.
author: Amy Nicole W.

description: Hit and miss quality. This place has gone downhill. Tried the chicken chili verde burrito again, and it was the plainest burrito I've ever had. Won't be back.
author: Richard S.

description: Been here three times. First time there was no flavor to my burrito and they got the filling wrong (take out, noticed when I got home that they gave me chicken instead of shrimp). Tried once more because it had no line late at night yet it still took eons to get my order; burrito was so-so and super soggy. I try to give a place three tries but I know better. Third time I ordered shrimp and it was not cooked through, gray and freezing cold. Also overpriced. Back to Little Taqueria and Pancho's.
author: Larkin C.

description:
I don't want this to be too harsh, but this place needs a lot of work. It just opened, so you know, will go back once they get things worked out, but it's been two months now and this place is still a mess.

The menu is confusing and doesn't really make sense. They, of course, got my order wrong. Ordered the white fish ceviche, got the shrimp. Not the end of the world, but not what I paid for. 

Also, the tofu, no. I love tofu tacos, but this is large chunks of tofu, or what another person next to me called "Tofu Logs." Which means the inside of the tofu, it had no flavor. Smaller pieces. Also, here's a tip if the owners are reading this: freezing tofu creates little pockets, little holes, makes the tofu spongey, yes, but if you chop it up into small m-&-m size pieces, they soak up that flavor sauce real good.

Here's another thing: no enchiladas? 

I don't mind waiting, they took a while, that was cool, they warned us with a sign that shows a cook just standing there, not doing anything, so I guess that might be one reason they take their time. 

This place has potential, but what I don't get is why they're trying to reinvent the wheel. Mexican food. It ain't that hard in this city. The Inner Richmond desperately needs a good taqueria. So far, this one ain't it.
author: Joe V.

description:
Pretty good option in the Richmond, but the quality is a little inconsistent. I'm guessing there are different cooks, since the Al Pastor is legitimately a different taste and texture some days versus other days. Same for the chicken mole and even the rice. When it's good it's really good, but other days I'm disappointed by the food.

I do like that they're open for dinner, but for lunch I prefer Little Taqueria just a block or two away.
author: Doug T.

description: The BEST EVER!  Do you know they serve fried plantains with crumbled quest fresco and mango salsa with crema on the side??  Holy moly, yes please!!  This place is authentic Yucatán food and it looks like we finally have a killer spot for great Mexican fare in 94118!!!!  Life is good.
author: Melinda A.

description: Horrible service, came here to see the game and have a burrito but they refused to change the channel. The guy was actually very rude about it. The food here is mediocre at best. I will not be coming here again.
author: Hillary G.

description: It's great to have a Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood, especially one with vegetarian options. My go-to is the plantain burrito and I also like the taco salad. Watch out for add-ons as they add up quickly.
author: Jenn F.

description: Not only is this place delicious, affordable and quick, but the owners and staff are extremely nice.  I don't think I've ever been here and not been looked after very attentively. The food is always fresh and hot.... and the portions are generous!! I'm working my way through the menu and always look forward to my next visit.
author: Torun H.

description: I was grumbling at first about the price-- $16 for a burrito and an horchata-- however, everything was really delicious. I got the super burrito with the cochinita pibil (pork) and it was amazing. Super moist and flavorful. The chips that come with the burrito were really crispy and the salsa was nice as well. The horchata was creamy and had a strong cinammon flavor. If I lived in sf I would come back for sure
author: Carolyn E.

description: This place has great food and the owner & staff are super friendly! We like them so much we decided to have them cater an event for us. The catering service was top notch and food was amazingly good. Highly recommend this place for a meal (or catered meal). I agree the prices lean a bit on the higher side, but it's fantastic to (finally) have a good Mexican place in the Richmond neighborhood.
author: Scott G.

description:
What a great place! I had such an great experience. The food was delicious, the employees were nice, the place looked clean and nice.
I am a vegan, and one thing I would have appreciated was more dietary specification (which things are vegetarian, vegan, dairy free, etc.)
The other thing I noticed was that the chip servings were very small. We ordered chips with salsa and guacamole, which we assumed would come with the appropriate amount of chips, but we had to get up to order more. 
This place is very tasty and I would come back again! Totally recommend!!
author: Elsa B.

description:
It's been long overdue I wrote a review of my new favorite taqueria in San Francisco.  It's not your typical spot and greasy purest (of what I have no idea) may not find it genuine, but let me tell you it is.

The mix of northern and southern Mexican flavors, fresh ingredients, and amazing friendly service had finally brought a spot you can find authentic homemade food.  For example, recently they changed the tamales noticeably.  Found out they changed to a longer process to get a better product.

I saw someone call this place out for not having hot enough sauces.  Clearly the misguided fool did not try the right one.  Considering they serve you 3-5 sauces with your meal you have a choice of great authentic sauces.  Now I mention "authentic" because in Mexico they don't have to burn your palate to be Mexican.  That's what's great with this regional type of Taqueria.

The staff is great and really care about your experience.  The owner in speaking to him more than anything wants to serve great food and since my first time until now working with his cooks the difference has been substantial!  Love it!

My favorite is the changes to the El Pastor I took in my Taco Abuelito and the carne asado on my Panucho (Yucatán taco) are my favorites.  The ceviche was to die for...and OMG the Churrros! So good...

Thank goodness Clement and the Inner Richmond finally has a great Taqueria!

#sftaqueria #innerrichmond #sffoody #sfeats #goodfood #greatfood #taqueriasf #taqueria #clementstreetsf #tacos
author: Tighe O.

description: Much needed cuisine in the neighborhood! Love that this is not a taqueria. Ample seating and the food is made to order (be patient and watch soccer on the TV's while you wait), incredibly fresh meats, seafood and ceviche. We ordered a good sampling of tacos, tostadas, empanadas, and ceviche. All the meats and fish have unique preparation and marinades to choose from. Love the concept of picking your meat and the way it is served up (e.g. in a taco or on a tostada or in an empanada). Various salsas which were all very good. Casual atmosphere and does take out as well. The owner/chef even came out to talk to us about all the food and brought us a special taco.  Very excited to go back!!
author: Andrea R.

description:
For years I've been wishing there was at least one burrito joint on Clement between Arguello and Park Presidio and Finally, we have Taqueria Los Mayas. 

Funny enough we as walked towards it, I saw a two guys coming out of Koja Kitchen,  carrying a few bags of utensils and as soon as we stepped into Los Mayas, I realized that the the Koja guys must either own it, or they're helping out a lot. 

I ordered a super beef burrito, which was tasty, but I kinda felt like they'd made a mistake and given me maybe a super vegetarian as I really could not detect any beef at all; it was huge, it was tasty, but that tasty seemed to be lacking in any meat flavor or texture---not really any chunks of meat, nothing. Maybe it was ground beef? 

Onward. One of the things I really love about Koja, besides it just being one of my tasty favs is the fact that it has all compostable utensils; forks, spoons, the little trays and it can all be tossed into the compost bins, no thinking ( and there are a lot of people that don't)  needed. 

If the same guys own Los Mayas, I hope you figure this out as I think we had plastic utensils. 

Otherwise, big TV screens and a good crowd rolling in, best of luck to Los Mayas.
author: bob s.

description:
The food is made to order, but the wait isn't too long. The food is reasonably priced and it very good. Service is very friendly. We met the co-owner of the place. You can tell he really cares about the quality of food and how he wants his restaurant to be represented. If there is a mistake with the food, I'm sure something would be done to correct it. 

Most burritos that I've tried at other places leave you super tried and groggy because it's so heavy. The Al Pastor burrito that I had left me very full, but I wasn't overwhelmed by a food coma. Would recommended! 

Their Panuchos is very good as well. Super juicy and flavorful.

The Ensalada Yucatán was reported to be good by the girlfriend as well.

I suggest you guys make a visit here!
author: Anthony T.

description:
Man listen ok...my co-worker was going to this restaurant for lunch, I asked her to bring me back 2 tacos, she said they're really small tacos (street tacos) so I should get 3. ok that's cool and all. So she came back to work and I was like "how much I owe you"? she said $15.00 , first off why? so I looked at the receipt this place charges extra for everything smh, but whatever I paid her and went on my lunch. When I opened my box, there were 3 REGULAR tacos nothing fancy. There was hella meat  and cilantro. The cheese was literally a pinch and so was the sour cream. The meat was so bland. I could've went to East Oakland near Fruitvale or by Lake Merritt and the tacos are about $1.50 . I swear San Francisco cheat  people out their money lol. You can get a whole meal at La Pinata lol ok ok let me stop. but im never going back here ever again not worth it. 


The one good thing I could say is that they have this green salsa that was delicious . But im still cool off this place.
author: Sjauna J.

description:
You know when a new restaurant opens by your house and you're a vegan so you desperately hope you'll a. have an option that is worthwhile and b. actually enjoy the food? Well thank goodness this place is so delicious! I moved to the area recently and was so bummed we didn't have any Mexican food nearby. There also aren't a lot of vegan-friendly options so I was relieved to hear they would be able to feed me. 

First of all, the staff is super nice and helpful! They went back and forth with the kitchen to make sure the fixings were vegan without any huffing and puffing. Sadly, this can be pretty rare so their willingness to help is very much appreciated. 

Onto the food, I got the grilled veggie burrito (sans cheese) and it was so good! Their rice, beans, tortillas and vegetables are all vegan! No chicken broth, lard (not sure about the refried beans), or butter is used to cook these items. Typically vegetarian burritos aren't the best tasting, super small (because you have to substitute everything out) and overpriced. They provided a huge burrito with delicious, flavorful veggies, beans and rice... yes it was ALL good! The veggies were and assortment of carrots, pink onions, cabbage and mushroom perfectly cooked and seasoned to lime-flavored perfection. Only suggestion would be to grill the burrito for a nice crispy texture before wrapping it up but it was still perfect. Papalote is my #1 but Los Mayas is more affordable so that may change. 

Needless to say, I'll be back... Every week
author: Katie B.

description: I really love this place and usually eat the veggie burrito. Everything always looks good. They have friendly and competent staff, open seating and soccer on the tv.
author: Leah H.

description: Way too many things on the menu. I get anxious even walking to the counter. They need to edit it. Tacos are average.
author: Tiffany L.

description: We tried this out instead of our normal Koja ritual and all we can say is wow. The prices are reasonable, the food is fresh made to order and everything we had is fantastic. We tried a selection of items and had the OX tail soup which was AMAZING! Love this new, gourmet Spanish walk up!
author: Sean B.

description:
It's nice having another option open until 10PM in the Inner Richmond, but I was rather surprised when I unwrapped my $11 cochinita super burrito to discover that it was rather small and poorly wrapped. I will acknowledge that the pork, even at the end of the night, was tender, albeit a little bland. However, halfway through my burrito, black beans and crema started falling out of the bottom and I was soon left with a mess reminiscent of someone's first time tackling a Chipotle burrito. Yep. Went there. 

Main points? Over priced and under portioned. Not bad, but the ingredients and flavors didn't make up for my initial disappointment.
author: Jason S.

description:
I'm giving Taqueria Los Mayas 5 stars because:

- The food was delicious, authentic and generous portions (not too little, but not too overloaded). The presentation was appealing and the depth of flavors on the dishes was appreciated.

- The menu has a variety of options and the side dishes are a nice bonus.

- They moved into the neighborhood and I couldn't be happier! Its going to be my staple go-to place. 

- The prices are reasonable for the quality of the food.

- The service was fast.

Thank you for being part of the neighborhood and making it better.
author: Elisa P.

description: I love that they have tofu, we go here regularly because of that.  But please, Taqueria Los Mayas be more careful about meat getting in your vegetarian burritos! This has happened to me twice. I'm super forgiving but for other vegetarian/vegan people it could absolutely mean the loss of a customer.
author: Dee R.

description:
I would highly recommend this place. I called in an order for pick up and they were 100% accurate with the time it would be ready (which was only 10 minutes). 

I ordered a super burrito w/ Carne Asada and the food is amazing. 

The cashier that took my order over the phone was there to ring me up and she was super sweet and respectful from the beginning to the end. I believe her name was Julia. This girl deserves a raise! :) 

I'll definitely be back.
author: Connor M.

description: Recently moved down the street and decided to check this place out. It is one of the only modern feeling restaurants on the block, with most of the buildings are older. There are glass windows and the interior is well lit and features a Mexican painting on the wall. There was Spanish music playing and the cashier was very nice and friendly. I ordered the taco salad, which came with chips, several salsas and had a really nice presentation. I also ordered the horchata which had a nice flavor but lacked some cinnamon taste imo.
author: Mary S.

description: I absolutely love that we have a new and amazing taqueria in the area. I was thoroughly impressed by the three tacos I had. The homemade corn tortillas were delicious and hearty enough to both physically carry the taco fillings as well as compliment them with flavor. A great selection of salsas accompanied the tacos and their hot salsa was impressively spicy while still being delicious. To top it all off their horchata was super yummy.
author: Sarah U.

description:
Liked this place.  Had a cochinita super burrito, and the meat is delicious.  Expensive at $11 for a super, but I'll be back for it.  Tacos were tasty, carne asada a bit bland, and they were very small for $3.75.  Very good agua fresca, both watermelon and horchata.   Stingy with the salsas.  Let us get our own please.  :)  

Employees were quick and friendly, but no real reason to tip more than a dollar or two.  No one does anything for you, including bussing tables.  Good place, really happy to have in the neighborhood.
author: Kean S.

description: First time here and I am not disappointed. I had the camarones quesadillas and it was amazing! The flavor was great and a nice grill on the tortilla like I like! Also I tried all of the different salsas offered and really enjoyed each of them. The consistency and flavor of each one was perfect. If you love Mayan food this is your place!
author: Debra C.

description: The food was delicious. Tried the tacos, and the tortillas were handmade and to die for. Also tried the ceviche mixto and churros, it was all amazing. It was a little pricier than I am used to for quick Mexican food but the extra spent was definitely worth it.
author: Valerie S.

description: This place shouldn't be rated 4 stars. They have high quality food. Lots of different flavors to choose from. The owner is from the Yucatan and has really created a great taqueria. They were a little slow to start and getting everything organized and streamlined. But now they have all the Kinks ironed out. This is really great food!
author: Lucy E.

description:
Los Mayas and Little Taqueria are duking it out for burrito dominance in our hood. First we got one burrito place, which was a miracle in itself, and then we got Los Mayas!
