Both places have their strengths, and I like them for different reasons. Los Mayas has intriguing flavors, from a part of Mexico most typical SF Taquerias overlook. I would say that the palate leans towards sweet /sweet and salty, and some folks are not down with that. I think that's why there's some criticism about this place. That said, I LOVE their chicken burrito, which has flavors of orange. You can have a plantain burrito with any kind of protein, and my vegetarian husband swoons over their tofu & veggie burrito. He has that sometimes with plantain. We also love the empanadas, which are deep fried. We ask for just cheese, and they're happy to oblige. For a special street - food treat they have the elotes locos. We only ever get stuff to go, so I can't speak to the restaurant dining experience.
When they first opened, there were a few bumps mainly with cooks not paying attention to the order tickets and incorrectly including milk in beef burritos, etc. HOWEVER. The owner actually HAND DELIVERED the correct order to my HOME. That kind of customer service has been long dead in SF. This guy really cares about the quality of customer interactions and the quality of his food. He's never been anything other than polite, and has also double checked our to go orders to make sure no mistakes are made. I think this place is great. Los Mayas finally broke through the asian restaurant glass ceiling on Clement. Us long-time locals are stoked.
author: roz A.

description:
Very good Mexican food , I ready like the carne asada súper burrito, my friend got the cochita pibil torta and he love it . 
Churros so good .!!!!!!
author: Wilbert A.

description:
So excited this spot is finally open! The Inner Richmond has been in need of a quality Mexican spot for quite some time. Sounds like the owner has another spot in North Beach that has done well, very happy they decided to come to Clement!

We tried the panucho with poc chuc, tacos with cochinita pibil, and a super burrito with al pastor. Everything was delicious! Can't wait till they get their beer license.
author: Mark C.

description: My boyfriend and I have eaten here quite a few times. The food itself tastes great, but we have both become extremely sick after eating here. The first time was in September, and I thought maybe it could have been something else I ate, but it happened again yesterday to the boyfriend. We won't be coming back which sucks because I really really wanted to love this taqueria! So close to home but not worth food poisoning... :(
author: Alexis J.

description:
》Pros: location, cleanliness, menu options, fresh ingredients, flavorful food (good helping of guac/crema if that's your jam), portion, friendly staff
》Cons: rice a bit undercooked at times, missing ingredients in order
》3.5 stars

Been here a couple of times because I like the food. This time, we ordered to go for the family. I ordered a taco salad for the second time and it wasn't until I was home that I saw my salad was missing: bell peppers, mango slices and queso (was a topper when previously ordered). I did find fresh corn at the bottom, but it definitely did not replace the other missing ingredients.

Unfortunately, this visit was disappointing. Hopefully future visits won't disappoint with wrong orders/missing ingredients!
author: Jessica H.

description: Super friendly staff, awesome mole burrito, and great addition to the inner richmond!
author: Phil S.

description: We went there late last night and ordered burritos. There's not much to add to what's already been said.  We felt both burritos were both very, very good! My only complaint was that the music was way too loud - you couldn't hear across your own table. The problem is there are no speakers in the counter and kitchen area, so the staff blasts the music loud enough to hear it in the back. That may make the sound level just right when you're behind the counter, but it's WAY TOO loud in the dining area. Really, really, too loud. I realize the staff deserves to hear music, too, so please install some speakers in the kitchen and counter area for the staff so your customers don't have to suffer. The music selection itself was great, by the way. Hey, if you need some crazy loud music, why not just go across the street to Neck of the Woods?
author: Richard A.

description: I don't write many reviews but I had to for this one. Carne asada super burrito was legit. The mango salsa is a must too.
author: Aaron S.

description: Came across this place and decided to try it! We ordered the panuchos with mole, chile verde, carne asada and al pastor. These things are delicious, especially their pickled onions!  I also tried the bean and cheese empanadas and they were ok. But seriously people try the panuchos! They also had good music so that was a plus for me!
author: E U.

description:
TLDR: Okay burrito that's more convenient than tasty. Worth a visit if you're in the inner Richmond and sick of Chinese,Japanese, Korean, Thai, Burmese, or Vietnamese. 

Variety in the inner Richmond is always nice, however some improvements could be made.

I've had their burrito a couple times now and each time it seems to lack a strong flavor. The meat just doesn't stand out as it should, the salsa isn't spicy enough, and the rice,beans, and cheese just fall flat.

I enjoy their house salsas but they'd be much better in the burrito, assuming they can remove the extra water/juice that seems to constantly flood my tortilla.

I hope they improve as it's nice to have a non Asian restaurant in the neighborhood but some improvements are needed.
author: Ben M.

description:
Taqueria Los Mayas offers a more elevated style of tacos and Mexican food at more elevated prices, compared to your standard Taqueria without table service. The plates are more artfully arranged, which, per usual, means smaller portions. The flavors were good, but somehow misses the comfort and charm of the typical Mexican fare. 

I had the Al Pastor pork Plato and platanos, with tortillas, beans, and salsa. They provide free corn chips and a raft of several salsas. The pork was pretty good, though I think I'll try a different protein next time. The black beans were unexpectedly puréed, but were still pretty good. 

The ambiance is probably more on the casual side, and doesn't quite match up the tone of the food. They have TVs going all the time, so it's probably a decent place to catch a game.  There's a good amount of seating if it's not especially busy. 

Overall, I'd probably rate this as more of a three and a half stars for now, until I make a second trip.
author: Christine L.

description: Clean place. I got the super quesadilla it was ok. I like sour cream and there's was pretty good. But then I was over it right away. My order became soggy and very wet from the salsa And I got over charged.
author: Louise Ann B.

description: Food was good but the service pretty lousy. The cashier(maybe the owner) was a grump & inpatient taking our order even though the menu is huge & we were asking for suggestions. We ordered almost $100 in food, you think he'd help us first timers out. Then when we sat down I noticed he charged me $15 for a dish we didn't even order. Then we noticed our appetizer was missing that we DID order. The nice guy in the kitchen fixed that and they sent the bill. I'm huge on customer service and in new spots In the city i'd really think they'd be big on that too.
author: Chayla G.

description: I am so happy when I saw there's taqueria around my area.. I love Mexican food a lot. I've tried all their food and drinks and all the  foods were amazingly delicious
author: Suzane S.

description:
Besides being your only real option for Mexican food in the immediate area, Taqueria Los Mayas is one of the best casual Mexican restaurants in the city, and certainly the best Yucatecan food I've ever had.

First of all, the ambiance is great and does a fantastic job of creating a casual dining experience, while still definitely being nice enough for a low key date night.

The food is the real attraction here; if you've never had Yucatecan food, you are in for a treat. I recommend the Panuchos, Poc Chuc, Cochinita, and Ceviche- all AMAZING. While Los Mayas does a great job of offering all of your standard taqueria fare, it is these traditional Yucatecan dishes that should really put this place at the top of your "to try" lists. If you're not sure what to order, just ask the staff; they are always very helpful and friendly.

Can't wait for these guys to get a liquor license! :)
author: Nick D.

description: The burritos were relatively decent but we asked not to have anything with pineapple due to allergies and we still received the pork that's marinated with pineapple.
author: Bryan G.

description: Had a good friend take me here today for breakfast and I'm forever changed. I had the green chilaquiles with chicken and they were amazing. I now must come here each and every time I visit SF.
author: Milton S.

description: Love this neighborhood addition :) favorite for my comfort food of quesadillas, mole, and a taco salad (perhaps not sure authentic in that). Good flavors!
author: jackie h.

description: If you like burritos, you won't like this place.  Their carne asada is pulled beef, their rice isn't seasoned, it's just not a burrito.
author: Sergey G.

description: We love your food, you guys are solid. Eat here all the time. Please consider opening earlier on weekends and please add a changing table to your spacious restroom.
author: Jo D.

description:
Super good and service was local Neighborhood friendly. 

I got the Cochinita pibil (first pork item on the menu) and it was delicious!! 

We will definitely be back
author: Brandie G.

description: Refried black beans in a chicken mole burrito with plantains: amazing! So many of my individual favorite things to find in a burrito place, all rolled into one. Delicious variety of salsas, and a long list of filling options including al pastor and mole. I will definitely be returning for more in the future- yum.
author: Christopher L.

description:
So I had heard taqueria los mayas had just opened, I hadn't heard anything about it so I figured I would see for myself how it was. Upon first walking in I must say the restaurant was pretty clean, The menu was very confusing at first glance but after staring at it for a couple of minutes I figured out the layout. One must take notice that some items on the menu do not have prices. This is because they will tell you the price right as you're checking out because it is higher than normal.  Whatever, I'm a small business owner so I know how you have to do what you need to do to pay your lease and stay in business. I gave a 20% tip and waited for my food.  For one people behind me got their order before I did but I didn't really care about that. I kindly asked one of the employees if I could get a side of sour cream once I had gotten my food.  She came back out with it and handed it to me and then said that will be a dollar. At that point I felt like she was being a bit petty since I had already checked out and it said no we're on the menu that sides were extra.

I had ordered a supreme quesadilla which was supposed to have come with sour cream but it didn't, I was a bit shocked to find out that I had to pay extra for it while on the phone she waited at my table until I came up to the register with the cash and then proceeded to charge me for the sour cream as well as tax on what was under two dollars for a quarter size of sour cream. Clearly irritated, I took my change in my back to my seat while continuing my phone conversation. Apparently it was funny and she had the need to tell everyone behind the counter that I said it was a joke to charge sales tax on a side of sour cream that was to have come with my entree. I am more irritated at the lack of customer service especially after I left a giant tip for them doing absolutely nothing on their end. It's customer service that is not petty that make businesses successful.  As far as the food goes I was not impressed, the Americana on 35th and balboa has their quesadillas than this "Mexican" restaurant.

I don't normally leave bad reviews but when I have and an exceptionally bad experience I want others to be aware. The best two things about this place for the Flawn and me being able to walk out the door and never return.
author: Dario L.

description: Good tacos! The guac is consistently ok- we really enjoy taking 6 home, rather than hanging at the restaurant itself. So many different salsas also make it so each bite is a little different. Went there during the heat wave and that seemed rough for everyone including the staff sweating over our food
author: Brianna S.

description: This place recently opened with much fan fare, only to be an underwhelming disappointment. I've had a lot of things here, but in general the taste has been bland. Their salsas are NOT chunky.. only watery salsa that's hard to eat with their chips. The chicken in their burritos doesn't have as good of a flavor as other nearby places. Pancho's has a much better taste. But they sure charge premium prices here.
author: Ronnie G.

description: I was really looking forward to carne asada. Sadly whay we got was braised beef. Braised beef is not carne asada. Their menu does not list any braised beef option, so it feels as though they are trying to pass off braised meat as asada.  This is not the first SF Mexican food restaurant to do this. Very disappointing.
author: Diana R.

description: The best Mexican food in the Bay ! Beyond words panuchos were amazing the torta deAchiote tofu was amazing! Oh and did I mention the churros  so warm and delicious . They also have like 4 salsa options which are all so good ! Everything about this wonderful little gem is perfect I fell in love . I think I'm moving to the bay thank you taqueria Los Mayas
author: Orduno M.

description: Uhhhh so yeah, I feel bad about having to do this, but I came here because of the good reviews. Left utterly underwhelmed. Even though the service is nice, the food itself is utterly Americanized and tastes nothing like real mexican food. Maybe I'm spoiled by South San Francisco and the Mission, I don't know, but I derived ZERO satisfaction from my AL pastor super burrito. I suppose, you might enjoy this food somewhat if you come looking for more of a Chipotle style experience. But if you expect real mexican food... look elsewhere.
author: Leo G.

description: Had the plantain burrito and it was delicious as well as huge! Came with chips and 4 different types of salsa-all good. Will definitely be back. Looked like they had a pretty nice selection of other interesting things too. Yum.
author: Kaitlin S.

description: Tried this place again twice. The last two times the food wasn't great. The final time, my order was wrong. I won't be returning. Over priced, mediocre food, eh service.
author: Jessie A.

description:
The Clement area has been waiting for a burrito place. I work nearby and sometimes customers would ask me where they could go for a good burrito so this opening was a great addition to the neighborhood. 

I came here for the third time today. All three times I got the Carne Asada burrito. The first two times were quite good with the mini sauces that comes with the chips as well. The yellow one especially compliments the burrito well. If I wrote my review based on the first two times, I would've gave them a 4 or a 5. This third time around, I noticed the burrito went from $9.75 to $10.75. At first I wasn't too bothered as long as the quality stayed the same but unfortunately, it didn't. The first two tasted like everything was fresh. The third time, the mini cup sauces were like gelatin and didn't pour out smoothly (one of the female workers there were nice to give me an extra cup of sauce though). Besides that, the burrito was the main disappointment today. The flavors were there but for some reason, the first bite and a big portion of the bottom were drenched in oil. At first I thought it was the juice from the meat but it was definitely oil. The oil went through the burrito foil, two layers of paper towels and onto the table. It's as if the $1 increase was to pay for the extra oil your burrito comes with. Gross.

I literally feel sick right now in my stomach and I still have over an hour at work.
author: Sherman L.

description: I'm addicted. The chicken mole plantain burrito is amazing and so is all their salsa. Plus its fresh and affordable and fast!! Great service. Love this place and sooo glad we now have great mexican food in the Inner Richmond.
author: Katie L.

description: The food here isn't bad,it's just incredibly underwhelming. My breakfast burrito was very skimpy on the egg and was mostly rice filler (and peas oddly).  My girlfriend had the elote and chicken tamales and was equally underwhelmed with them.  Everything here seems to taste fine, but is incredibly bland.  We tried all their salsas and not a singly one had any spice to it. To top things off, our chips were really stale. I just can't think of a reason why I'd try them again given all of the far superior mexican options in this city.
author: Joshua W.

description: Best burritos in the Inner Richmond, and probably out of all the places I've tried in SF. Their burritos are hardy af, and the protein choices all taste fn amazing.
author: Ian B.

description: Decent food but bad service. Had communication trouble with the cashier.  When I asked for correct change, the cashier would not give correct change. Dishonest. It's only $3, but what is right is right.
author: Ron S.

description: This is one of my favorite taquerias. We live a block away so I'd say we come here at least 3 or 4 times a month since they opened after Quickly. The food is on point and the staff is gracious and accommodating. Sadly, what stops me from giving them five stars is that my husband and I joke that he will always do two trips there because inevitably our order is always wrong. The staff again is so gracious and always offer to remake food, but it'd be nice to go there and then come home and stay home. Luckily they're only a block away so it's not a difficult trip. It's just consistently wrong and if it's only one item, by the time that one is fixed, the other one is cold if we wait for each other to eat, which is nice to do, I think. But even cold, thank goodness the flavors still come through. It'd just be nice to have a great dinner together while the food is hot and after only one trip. Please!
author: cindy l.

description:
Tasty and with a little improvement, they could be excellent. Burrito had a lot of meat but missing cheese, cream, and guacamole. Hot salsa perked up the flavor. 

Panucho was dry chicken on a thick cracker. Sopes was much better.  The dry chicken had sauce, crema and a mango salsa. I enjoyed it a lot.
author: Shauna P.

description:
Came here during the soft opening and enjoyed the food so I decided to go back again to try something else. I ordered the taco bowl salad with refried beans instead of black beans and thought it would be a simple request. I got my salad bowl with the regular black beans so I went back and asked for it to be made with my original request of refried beans. The man whom I gave the request to gave me a dirty look and looked annoyed that he had to go back and ask the cooks to remake it. I went back to my seat to wait for the new order but he came to me and asked me again if I really wanted him to remake the order with refried beans in it or just have refried beans on the side. I asked him nicely to remake it with refried beans. He then came back to me again telling me it would take another 15 mins to remake and I told him that was totally ok with me. The whole ordeal made me feel really uncomfortable for asking my food to be made with a simple request so I didn't enjoy my food at all.

On top of that, they don't have salsa easily accessible so I had to send my boyfriend and sister to ask for more salsa so I didn't have to deal with him anymore. They really need to let people have more salsa because I love hot sauce with my Mexican food. The food is ok but the service is poor.
author: Shannon L.

description: Previously only a Gordo burrito eater (at least on the Richmond side and i do still love Gordo's carnitas)  I thought I would try something new and was recommended this place by my barber.  Super impressed!  I got a regular Burrito with Chile Verde chicken + Guacamole and it was seriously one of the better Chile Verde's I've had in a long time. It takes a little longer than your average burrito place where you order by pointing at things, they have a real kitchen in the back and make your burrito in there while you lounge in the front with a buzzer. Nice big TV's to watch while you wait for your order. Way more relaxing experience than standing in line at your average burrito place, and more importantly delicious results.  Super clean and modern inside.  It's basically a better Chipotle. Totally coming back here.  Also have a lot more on their menu that I will be trying out.
author: Jonathan W.

description: I was pleasantly surprised to stumble upon this place when I was looking for something to eat in the area. Seemed a little out of place-- a Mexican restaurant amongst all the different Asian varieties but I decided to give it a try and it had considerably good yelp reviews. I ended up ordering the super quesadilla with vegetables and it was so flavorful I was really surprised! It seemed like they cooked a variety of vegetables and placed the guacamole inside the quesadilla and cooked it together which made it for a really cheesy, gooey, delicious meal. The chips that came with it we're also homemade and they gave three types of salsa which I believe one was mango one was a smoked tomato and the other kind was your standard red salsa. The girl at the cashier stand was very nice and friendly.  I had some quesadilla left over and gave it to my boyfriend and he wanted more! Every time I come to comment in the enrichment I'm constantly overwhelmed with so many restaurant choices so I'm glad this random pic turned out so well and I highly recommend it for some authentic Mexican cuisine
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood! 
Finally a authentic Mexican restaurant on clement. Prices are great and the food is even better. I can see this place becoming more and more popular. The line was out the door and it was just their soft opening! Didn't get a chance to try the corn but it looks delicious. Can't wait for more!
author: Monica C.

description: Super fresh, simple, and very tasty.  Plus they make their own tortillas, Inner Richmond was long overdue for a very solid Taqueria, one of the better in the city.
author: Rosco T.

description: Am i the first person to review? Haaaa, i hope so :p Just had a late dinner togo here. We live in the neighborhood just a block away. So excited to have them here :) Let me tell you, their food is amazing. We have 2 burritos and tacos. I totally didn't know what their name lol (sorry). As a first comer, we kinda lost to order what food is good here. A guy in register really nice and friendly, and there's one guy (i think he's the owner) also came to help recommend what food should we got. Overall its a nice experience. Love the food, love the ambience. :) Welcome to the neighborhood, guys!
author: Modja N.

description:
We planned our whole day around going to this place. We get there and a sign "closed, check back tomorrow" was in the window.

WTF? If you are a business person, you don't pull this kind of stuff. You explain WHY you are closed and when you will reopen. I now have no trust in this business at all. 

Still waiting for a REAL taqueria in this neighborhood.
author: Melissa M.

description: Finally a taqueria in this neighborhood! Not just any taqueria either, this place offers uniquely Mayan-Inspired creations. I am still working my way through the menu, but I particularly enjoy the empanadas - which are made with masa rather than a wheat flour. A large variety of meat/seafood/veg options ensure something for everyone; the 5-6 house-made salsas make each bite utterly customizable. This place is brand new so practice patience while they work out the kinks - we want them to be around for a long time!
author: Anna S.

description: Great now I will get fat! I have been in the neighborhood for several years and have always had to bike to the Mission for a decent burrito, but now it is a 5 minute walk from my house, great, bring on the pounds! It just opened and they are crushing the long awaited need of having a decent spot in the 'hood. The chicken mole burrito and the pibil burritos are very very good, the salsa and guac are super tasty, there is one salsa, the habanero stuff that will light you up inside and out, so be careful. I will be back and I will be back frequently. If they are still in their "soft" opening phase give them a call to double check that they are opn until they get totally rolling along. Happy to see this addition to the rest of the awesome food on Clement.
author: Ezra B.

description: A little different from a typical taqueria -- as they have mole poblano, for example. They have radishes and many salsas at the bar, and nice little dishes for them, in addition the little plastic cups. In the immediate area, this is probably one of the better taquerias.  They have a kids menu too.
author: Dan C.

description: Love the fact that there's finally a taqueria in the inner richmond. Didn't love the fact that the food AND salsa were so bland. Ordered a burrito and quesadilla, both had close to no flavor. Figured we'd remedy the situation with all kinds of salsa and to our surprise, we couldn't really tell the difference (except for the super hot one) between the salsa as that had no taste either.
author: Ken C.

description: Loved my super chicken burrito, great flavor, big portions. Great tasting salsas. I'll be back.
author: Robin R.

description: I don't take time to write reviews and I certainly hate to see my favorite places getting bigger lines, but I love this place and they deserve a great write up. Both affordable and delicious we haven't had one thing we didn't like and we've been about 10 times now. Be patient with them, the place is new and they don't quite have their groove down yet with cleanup and service but they are trying. They will get there though because they are aware that they need more help. All of the pork dishes is there are amazing and the chicken mole is out of this world. Fresh chips and salsas and please venture out from burritos and tacos because their more traditional options are so refreshing. All of the girls who have helped me behind the counter are very helpful in making choices so ask their opinion.
author: Betsy H.

description:
I've always wanted a taqueria on this side of Clement other than Gordos and this place is awesome!  It's super clean and friendly.  The burrito was yummy and I like spicy. We tried the ceviche and soup as well which were great. 
It's a nice Mexican restaurant with good prices.  It's not the typical taqueria where all the food is sitting in warmers. It is made fresh!
I'll be back as a regular.
author: CR L.

description: Finally a good Mexican place in the Richmond. Pricey compare to the Mission but happy to pay the premium to avoid the trek down.
author: Andrew C.

description: Mediocre food at outrageous prices. I understand this is the Richmond district and businesses gotta price accordingly to survive, but when you serve food that tastes like Safeway's hotbar at bistro price points, it makes it difficult to justify paying. I've been here over 10 times hoping that the food will improve, but it seems to get noticeably blander every time I dine.
author: Richard P.

description: Second time here. Really large portions. Cochinita Pibil is very good here and was super tasty as a quesadilla. I had the tamales. You get two and they put a pile of chicken on top as well. The tamales themselves were a little bland but with everything else it was a good meal. The side salad was excellent. Came with fresh corn, avocado and a nice vinegrette.
author: Priscilla C.

description: Pretty good burrito. The carne asada was good but had a lime flavoring I wasn't too fond of but I will deffinitley be back to try other things.
author: Adrien K.

description: Finally a place in the inner Richmond that can make a tasty burrito the way I asked for it to be made.  I even saw the man making my burrito recheck the order to make sure the order was correct- and my order was very unusual (being a vegetarian-sometimes pescatarian in Florida). Both unusual burritos were tasty and correctly made. The ladies behind the counter were friendly and helpful.  My only advice is the salsa needs to be in a larger container and spicier, but they tasted good. The chips were thick and crunchy.
author: Me M.

description:
My boyfriend and I really like this place. 
I ordered Cevhice Mixto -- which contains both fish and shrimp.
You get a pretty big portion for what you pay for.
I've tried ceviche at a number of restaurants in the SF Bay Area and this one is one of the best ones in my opinion. 
Will def come back again.

The only reason why I knocked off one star is for the Fresca we ordered.
It was $4 and it was pretty watered down. 
Def should have gotten a Mexican Coke instead.
Will do so next time.
author: Tiffany M.

description: This place is great. The staff is friendly and the food is awesome! This neighborhood definitely got a new gem of a restaurant. it seems like theu are known for their tacos and Panuchos. They always give you a healthy portion of meat and it is always tender and their tortillas are fresh. Definitely my go to spot in the area
author: mackenzie e.

description:
This is exactly what we needed in the Inner Richmond, delicious and good quality Mexican food! I was so happy enjoying my meal yesterday. I ordered the quesadilla with their slow stewed pork, a recommendation from the cashier and boy was I completely satisfied! Over simulated with the menu options and lively music I forgot to ask for jalapeños in my quesadilla so I asked one of the workers for some after I got my food. A minute or two passed and I was wondering what was taking so long and to my surprise he was in the back having the cook grill up a fresh jalapeño! It was the best! Thank you for an amazingly experience and delicious food! 

I will definitely be coming back!
author: Lela N.

description: What a fantastic addition to the neighborhood! Seems like the most authentic Mexican place here. Clean, bright atmosphere, delicious food. Friendly staff. Have already brought friends several times & they enjoyed it just as much. Will definitely be a regular here!
author: Mary D.

description: Came here and ordered 5 tacos (2 carne and 1 each of the pork tacos, 1 super burrito, and chips and guacamole. Almost no one inside and yet they forgot my guac and chips.... The tacos were really good though and the burrito was decent. I might come back to try their ceviche and shrimp tacos. 3.5, 4 if they didn't forget.
author: Christopher H.

description: We just happened to find this wonderful shop. The food was amazing and great prices. Clean and very inviting!!! When I come back to San Fran this will be my Stop for my taco fill!!! I had 2 super burittos and a quesadilla, heaping plates and some to go!!!
author: Kristy B.

description: New favorite place in the Richmond! Cochinita de pibil/ al pastor tacos are PERFECT. I've tried just about everything on the menu with those two meats and have loved them all. The corn + mango salsa make excellent additions as well. Just need this place to get their liquor license and it will be HOT.
author: Jordan F.

description: Well, I have to say I was happy to finally have a taqueria in my neighborhood but I can't say that it compares to the any of the good ones in the mission. First faux pas, not having hot sauce on the tables. I mean, the food should be made flavorful and enjoyable without it but I am of the opinion that if Mexican food doesn't burn my lips and tongue, it's wack. I mean I can even get that hot kick at Taco Bell down the street. To be frank, this is Mexican food for gringo taste buds. Try adding more spice and garlic to your food and don't serve chips that are hard as rocks. Two stars were given because everything seems to be pretty fresh and made to order and they have jarritos and mexi-coke.
author: Rudy G.

description: I love this place!!! What a great addition to the neighborhood!!! The food is fresh, authentic and delicious .  The salsas bar has a great selection of spicy salsas. They stick to the authentic taste of the Yucatán and traditions. It's a a great spot for kids and families.  The staff is quick and attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  I love their tamales and for dessert you have to try the churros, they are served fresh and warm....so good! I'm glad they opened here and it's clean!!!
author: Robert O.

description: Love this place!!! As of 2 months ago I've turned vegetarian, and I've been craving a good burrito, but so few burrito places have vegetarian options. I was so happy to find tofu as a protein option on their menu board, so I tried it in their regular burrito, and it was delicious!! Just as satisfying (if not more so) than a regular meat burrito in my opinion. To top it off, a lovely lady by the name of Jessica, who works there often, is so sweet! She's very happily accommodating and makes you feel welcome. If you're in the Richmond neighborhood, make sure you try this place out!
author: Arnelle L.

description:
Delicious food, really fresh and crispy. Just what we needed in this neighborhood! 
I have some dietary restrictions and they were really nice making accommodations for me. One of the owners, Juventino, suggested the tamales. I had the pork tamales with rice and beans. Absolutely delicious! He also offered some churros for us to try: what a delight! I hope to see it on the menu soon!!! 
Another highlight: their tortillas are handmade, 100% organic and gluten-free! 
We'll be back often!
author: Letícia L.

description: No greeting, confusing menu-board and a basic indifferent vibe !!! Why would I even want to eat here now? Man if yer having an issue with your cash register or whatever, LET people know. Do NOT ignore them, w.t.f. This kind of stuff may be endemic to SF but here's the thing, it's NOT acceptable ever.
author: Henry K.

description: I like this place a lot.  The camarones burrito is my jam.
author: Floyd B.

description: My go-to for Mexican food. Everything is made fresh and the panuchos are always great. Plenty of seating, bathrooms are clean, salsa bar is excellent. No beer yet but I'm told "it's coming". Will continue to visit from Berkeley where I live.
author: Joseph M.

description: Finally a great taqueria on Clement! My husband and I were looking for a late dinner and were happy to see this new place open until 10 - and it's actually hard to find a casual place open late in this part of town. But the opening hours were not why this place was great - the food was delicious; we got the fish tacos, plantains, and ceviche. All were very flavorful and the salsa was also really good, my favorite was the habanero. Finally - the people there were very friendly and delivered great service! Will definitely be back.
author: Maria G.

description: Good food - not off the charts but a solid burrito.  Checkout process needs some work.  I've ordered take-out and then had to wait in line 15 minutes to pick up and pay (at which point the food is a bit cold).
author: Matthew C.

description: We started going when it first opened and the food was spot on  with generous portions, very fresh, nice balance of flavors.  A few weeks into it and the dishes look like they have been slopped onto the plate.  I had a carne asada super burrito tonight and  was not sure if the meat was beef or some other mystery meat.  I had a couple  of bites and put the rest into the compost.  Will not eat there again. It's too bad they figured out so early in their tenure that people in SF will spend good money on flavorless food and give it 5 stars.
author: Beth B.

description: This place is AMAZING! I used to live in the neighborhood and always came here. I moved and still drive 15 minutes to come here. Jessica the hottest with the mostest and jube the amazing cook will blow your mind with there food! This place is a must!! 5 stars doesn't do it justice.
author: Chris D.

description:
Based on one Cochinito Super Burrito:

This restaurant has solid potential. The menu is intriguing enough in regards to Yucatecan authenticity. Sadly, the execution and flavor nuances of the Burrito were noticeably bland. I had to go home and doctor it up with my own salsa to bring it up to speed. The accompanying, microscopically portioned salsas were thimbles, barely filling the tip of your tongue. The classic sour orange, citrusy accents were lacking in the pork filling. In fact, the portions of the salsa were laughable to the point of being a joke.

The restaurant seems to be 'down' flavoring so not to offend anyone rather than cooking 'all out.' Perhaps it is deliberately underestimating the tolerance for heat and forward spiciness from its clientele as a business decision to reflect what San Francisco has become? San Franciscans had always appreciated a bolder, more extreme approach to seasoning or at least have the necessary condiments available to make adjustments to suit their tastes.

 As such, the Burrito was near flavorless and certainly over priced although the size was fine for me. Perhaps like the nearby and expensive Farmer's market, Taqueria Los Mayas has an eye on the 'Tony' and well-heeled Laurel Heights/Lake St. crowd. This demographic has no problem dropping $11.00 per slab. Price is no object in a rapidly gentrifying neighborhood, but  flavor should be. Trying for the white Yuppie market insults the grandeur of real Mexican cooking just like toned down Sichuan cooking seems fake.

Having said all this I still intend to come back and sample many of interesting items on the menu. One Burrito is obviously not enough exposure to form any judgment. This review is just a first impression, no more no less. Clement Street, as the Richmond District itself, is in desperate need of a quality Mexican Taqueria and Restaurant. It could be an easy and hugely successful enterprise if done right without compromises.

Analogously, when one goes out to eat Sichuanese cuisine one expects some real chili force; it is not the same as going to a good Cantonese restaurant where refinement and subtlety are the calling cards. So it's an issue of 'identity' through authenticity. Similarly, Taqueria Los Mayas should know what it is and should be. Dumbing itself down in the flavor department is a recipe for disaster and bad business. As Ice Cube says, "It's about being real." But then is San Francisco itself still 'real?'
author: George G.

description: My favorite place to get food in the neighborhood. I can't believe I have lived 33 years without ever experiencing the glory that is a panucho! Their sopes are also perfection. The meats are very fresh and the homemade salsas are flavorful and delicious. Everyone here is so friendly and accommodating. We come here often with our baby and they provide us with tortillas and avocado for the little guy. Love!
author: Veronica F.

description: Came in on a whim and the gentleman at the cashier was very friendly and helpful while I chose. I ended up getting 2 panuchos - one with pollo con mole poblano and one with carne asada. Both were delicious - kind of like open faced tacos, with generous portions of meat, plus avocado, lettuce, and pickled red onions. I will definitely be back soon!
author: J E.

description: I really wanted to like this place as it is new to the neighborhood. The staff was nice enough so that's why I'm giving it more than one star. It is by far the worst burrito I've ever had in SF. The pico de gallo and salsa inside the burrito was more of just a red hot sauce totally overpowering the flavors of everything else. Perhaps 1/10 the amount and it would have been better. Very little, if any cheese in it. The four salsas they gave for the chips were decent.
author: Jack L.

description: At last a great taquería in the Richmond District! And not only great tacos but a broad variety of Mexican dishes, with an emphasis on the cuisine of Yucatan. The food is fresh and delicious. Among my favorites are the panuchos! Great service, too!
author: Bolivar P.

description: I got a super burrito with steak meat. It was good. The portion is well balanced and it had much flavor. I got the mild sauce on the side but in the future I'll get the spicy one. The mild was very mild to me. Service was fast and the cashier was really friendly.
author: Amer M.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood! Had lunch there today and was impressed with the Mayan flavors and the prices. Conchinta Pibil burrito!
author: Gary F.

description: Our family is thrilled about this new taqueria! Great food, fun atmosphere, and friendly people.  We went last night, and I'm already craving another burrito. Taqueria Los Mayas will definitely be our go-to Mexican restaurant from now on!
author: Sarah A.

description: So friendly. Some of the most unique flavors. Way more than your typical Mexican restaurant. Clean and modern interior.
author: Jacob Z.

description: I know the area is desperate for Mexican food but I can't see how this place has a 4 star average rating. Tried: super burrito-al pastor and tacos-chicken mole, cochinita pibil,  al pastor. My husband was actually enjoying his burrito until I asked him to try a piece of the al pastor without drenching it in salsa so he could see how flavorless it actually was. He agreed and was sad eating the remainder of his burrito - sorry for the buzz kill honey. Chicken mole tasted very meh - I think if you used canned mole sauce with shredded chicken you would get a tastier result. Cochinita pibil - also pretty bland, definitely not a redeeming meat option. I think the biggest ripoff of the night though was the horchata for $4.50 which was SO watered down. I may try this place again because I really want there to be a good Mexican option in the area but the first impression left a bad (or actually lack of) taste in my mouth.
author: Angela C.

description: Oh my. This place is amazing. Get the panuchos and wait for your mind to explode. The ceviche, tacos and platanos were all amazing as well.  the new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Pagely T.

description:
Aw, we are a little disappointed :( :(
Really wanted to like this place, and so excited about a Mexican place on Clement. 

Good:
- they do a nice job with the accompanying veggies that go with the meats, it's a nice touch
- free chips that come with varying good sauces

Issues we had:
- confusing menu at first
- I had 3 tacos ($3.50 each) carne asada, chicken Verde, and Al pastor pork. The meats were all COLD! I didn't like eating cold tacos. 
- the meats were all cheap looking/tasting, and had completely no flavor. I tasted a lot of sour-ness from the lime, veggies, and fruit toppings, but the meats had no flavor. They were all strangely chopped up in TINY little chunks, and didn't taste like anything. The carne asada was tough, that was probably the worst taco of the 3. 
- I have a big stomach ache right now. And a sour taste in my mouth from the taco sauces. 
- my husband pulled out a pile of pickled onions in his burrito (he hates onions, and there was really a lot of it) he complained his burrito was cold as well, and the meat was also in tiny bits. I've never seen him not finish a burrito. 
- any seafood taco, including fish, was an extra $3, so $6.50 each. These tacos are not big, so that's kinda a lot to pay for

Overall, not crazy about a cold meal.
author: Minh D.

description: Very authentic, great customer service but a bit pricey. I guess you can do that when there's few to no competition.
author: Dee Q.

description: We have been waiting for a good Mexican restaurant to open in the Richmond district. Finally it is here. Taqueria Los Mayas was simply delicious this evening. Everything is made to order.The service was very good.  The presentation was well above expectations for a Taqueria. Their sauces are flavorful and spicy. We had the ceviche mix,  it was light and citrusy and full of perfectly marinated fish and shrimp. We also enjoyed a couple of panuchos with cochinita pibil.  The tortilla was slightly crispy the meat was well marinaded and tasty and perfectly spiced.  We also had two fish tacos. There were large chunks of fish cooked perfectly with bits of mango and tomato with a nice cabbage slaw below it, all on homemade soft tortilla.  This is not fast food Mexican. Every dish is made fresh, while you wait. Nothing is prepared ahead of time.  We can't wait to try more items on the menu, the next time we come back to this restaurant.
author: Rose V.

description: Amazing flavor on the dishes as well as salsa. Had the carne asada burritos, & the chicken panuchos. Would eat here again and highly recommend! Great service too
author: Derrick D.

description: Loved it! Great addition to the neighborhood. Friendly people and delicious food. I was very impressed with the wide selection of savory meats and fresh salsa.
author: Alex W.

description: Love this place! I have eaten at Taqueria Los Mayas four times - I've had their tacos, the panuchos, a burrito and a quesadilla. All have been excellent. The options are interesting, the flavors complex; the service is top notch and the owner is so hard working and friendly. I'm excited to go back!
author: Liz O.

description: Expensive and average. Definitely skip the Guac and ceviche. Both small, below average, and hella expensive. Tacos were good. The neighborhood wants good Mexican food, and for that I wish y'all the best.. but I'm not rushing back.
author: Bun B.

description: This was my first visit and I had a wonderful shrimp burrito!  Cooked perfectly to order, extremely clean tasting, and flavorful.  Friendly involved staff.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Robert R.

description: So excited to have this place join the neighborhood. Love that all food is made to order and happy to wait for it. Tasty food! Wish the team here all the best.
author: Christopher W.

description: AMAZING! We lived in Mexico and this is the best Mexican food we have had in SF. And yes, that includes the Mission. Very fresh, well made food, particularly the ceviche, any of the pork dishes (esp the cochinita and pastor), and homemade tortillas that were phenomenal. Carne asada also delicious. If you want something lighter, the wild, grilled fish in a banana leaf was great. Multiple, homemade salsa options too. No cocktails yet, but they said beer and margaritas and other cocktails (sangria) will soon follow. This is our new addiction. Bienvenidos Taquería Los Mayas!! We are so happy you're here!
author: C C.

description: I was super stoked about this place. The photos look amazing, the food looks great. I ordered the carne asada plate, and my wife got the ceviche. My meat came out as one big string of fat. My wife was splitting it with me, and she took the plate back. The cook told her, "Why are you bringing this back? You aren't even eating it?" They brought us another plate, but with that customer service, I won't be back soon. Get it together, Los Mayas! You can't do business in this city that way.
author: Porky T.

description: There are so many great restaurants on Clement St. and now there is another one. I stopped in for dinner. I'm vegetarian, so I figured I'd have to get my usual veggie burrito. Wrong. :)  They offer vegetable and tofu versions of each of the items on their menu. So I got a veggie panucho, a tofu sope and a mango aqua fresca. The veggie panucho was great. It even had pickled onions on top. The tofu in the sope was actually fried and tasted great. Usually when I get tofu in a Mexican restaurant it doesn't have much flavor, but this did. The aqua fresca was super fresh and not too sweet, just the way I like it. And the two salsa that came with the meal were fresh tasting and different from the usual salsas. One was fruity, possibly mango, and the other was tomato based but fresh and different from what I am usually served. I want to go back to try the elote loco and platanos too. It's really nice when a small restaurant like this has so many options for vegetarians, and that everything tastes authentic. I will be going back soon.
author: Kevin C.
